Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: ginal0l0
Reviews.Content: perfect situation in sultanhammet walking distance from main attractions .amazing breakfast on the roof with amazing view and on top of it beautiful and warm welcome from the owner would go back again lorraine and jack from canada

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Chris E
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, very good service, our room could have had a little more space...

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect place! a three minute walk to sultanahmet where the blue mosk and the haya sophya are located. Dogan the owner is amazing, he is very helpful and kind. He really makes this a different experience. The hotel is very pretty, small but after a long day the jacuzzi feels just perfect! I really really recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: AtMyOwnPace
Reviews.Content: This hotel pretty much delivered on everything it promised, if you look at the summary on the first page of their website. We were only on the second floor, but the view was still good. The room and hotel were super clean (yes, the nice ladies cleaning the rooms will definitely move your stuff, but that didn't bother us). We were in a smaller room, but for such a big city - I found it met my expectations. I've definitely stayed in smaller rooms in big cities and this size room suited us fine. The location, as mentioned, is excellent if you want to see all the main sites. When I was searching for a hotel, I remember thinking - how can all these hotels have exactly the same reviews "great location, great breakfast, wonderful hosts?" This area has pretty much been converted to a boutique hotel district, so it's probably all true. That said, I failed to walk by a hotel I wished I had booked instead. The owner isn't like all butterflies and roses and rainbows and hugs for hospitality. I think it's unlikely you'll leave with a new best friend forever, unless you really connect. He's super professional, though, and will happily and graciously help with questions and will allow plenty of time to do so. He gave us some great advice. Moreover, he's the sort of host where if you have a problem that needs 1,000 phone calls in Turkish, I think you could hardly do better. I saw him solving a couple problems like that for other guests. I read some of the older, not-as-happy reviews and it seems like they've made real adjustments to criticisms. They seem to now have a high chair, for instance, for babies at breakfast. And, black-out curtains. And, a little meat at breakfast. I think that speaks for their hospitality and responsiveness. Breakfast - any one who complains about it has high, strange expectations. It was a feast of freshly prepared Turkish dishes and plenty of more Western options like cereal, bagels and crepes. There were like 40 choices. We were there six days and definitely didn't try everything. I'd love to wake up every morning to a breakfast like this. I'm back now - and I'll probably either have cream of wheat or a donut this morning, but wish I could go up to a beautiful terrace and have a huge, wonderful breakfast that will keep me full for most of the day. They work hard at it and I definitely appreciated the spread. The only thing that was a little not perfect was a little bit of smoke smell some days. I'm not certain, but it seemed the culture and manners of Istanbul generally were to not ask you to do something and if you were discourteous to do it anyway, then they were generally too polite to react. The guards in museums were super relaxed as compared to America. The few things they ask for in mosques weren't followed in front of mosque staff and no one said anything. And, this hotel is supposed to be 100% smoke free, but someone at some point definitely decided to smoke. I think it happens intermittently. We didn't complain, so I'm not sure how that would have played out. But, I totally blame it on the guest and not the hotel. If you've read all the reviews and done your research and want to know if all the good things are true: they are. This is a good hotel. We had a great rate and I thought we made the very best choice for us for this trip. Istanbul is wonderful and not scary, not dangerous. People are nice, with a good sense of humor. It's a great vacation spot with plenty of historical treasures. One small note: the restaurant up the street about a block on the right (sort of the closest restaurant not affiliated with a hotel) was the worst meal we had, although not bad. If you simply walk a little farther you can probably do a whole lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Home Away from Home in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Sheldon L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to everything, yet on a quiet street. The best part was our host family. We received the best of genuine hospitality and attention to all our needs, great and small, and very much enjoyed their company as well as the other guests in the hotel. The immediate neighborhood is quite fascinating, and we loved simply walking around, as well as visiting the museums within walking distance as well as ones easily accessible from the tram that was very close. The hotel is a lovingly restored Ottoman building, with a great shower, tub and/or jacuzzi and the elevator was just excellent. It took us to the rooftop terrace where we had a very nice view and breakfast that featured regional specialities as well as the usual fare. My husband needed a lot of dental work that we found to be very excellent and much more affordable than in the USA, so we will return, and do not want to stay anywhere else but the ADA! Sheldon and Marilyn, Alexandria, VA, USA

Reviews.Title: “Warm Turkish Hospitality at It's Best”
Reviews.Author: Heather M
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Hotel Ada for those of you traveling either as a single traveler or family. Originally, we chose the hotel based on the delightful Boshophous views and ideal location to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. I was taken by the well run and high tech services provided from the onset. The owners were so attentive to our every need from airport transportation, tour recommendations, insights into the culture and ensuring an early buffet breakfast prior to the tour departures. Having stayed at many hotels in the past, this was my first experience to a boutique hotel and the city. I certainly would return to the Hotel Ada for any future visit. Beds are comfortable and the room spotless. Breakfast has more options than you'd expect with savory and sweet dishes at your disposal with both Turkish and Western coffee and tea. I appreciated the attention to detail and the high tech security features in the room. All the guests we spoke to enjoyed their experiences like us and we swapped stories on the recommended tourist attractions. The foyer permitted us some great conversations with the charming owners and other guests alike. As a former travel industry professional, I cannot recommend this property highly enough. Having visted over 30 countries and countless properties in my lifetime, this is one that stands head and shoulders above the competition. You can book this hotel with confidence. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very helpful owner”
Reviews.Author: AStar1973
Reviews.Content: I was super sick when we got to Ada hotel (got pneumonia hiking), and the owner was so very helpful and flexible with us. We changed our plans approximately 10 times, and he was helpful trying to work it out so we could change rooms as little as possible, etc. The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was good. The showers were warm. Additionally, there is a computer with internet access (actually a modern laptop, as opposed to places that have a desktop from 1992 that can barely load google maps). Plus, there's a phone where you can make free phone calls to the US (super useful when you want to call the advice nurse like every day). Finally, it was conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Respite from Chain Hotels”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJanice
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here in mid-January. Our stay originally was for 4 nights (but thanks to a United Airlines snafu that delayed us 22 hours), we were able to stay only 3. The owners were extremely hospitable about our delay resulted in many emails, etc. about transportation, etc. Fortunately we were picked us, and that was a bonus as it would have been hard to find on one's own. We had an upgraded room which presented a fine view overlooking the mosque. While we were there, however, it poured and poured and rain seeped in around our windows. Not a problem for us, but my heart went out to the owners. Seems like the problem is the flashing around the roof and windows, not an easy (and cheap) thing to fix on a tall old building. Various power outages during our stay, but not confined to the hotel but to Istanbul/Sultanhamet in general. Staying here reminded me more of staying in B&B or with a family friend than a traditional hotel. The bedroom included a hot tub (which neither of us used), and the bathroom was small but clean and functional. If you come expecting the amenities of a Fairmont or even a Hilton or Sheraton, you are likely to be disappointed. Easy walking distance to major sites (Blue Mosque, Tokapai Palace, Grand Bazaar), etc. and easy access to streetcar that provides access to other parts of Istanbul. We thought the breakfast was very nice...no, it was not the huge spread that big hotels provide, but a very nice assortment of Turkish dishes, coupled with quiches, crepes, that would appeal to others. The view from the roomtop breakfast area was astounding. What was equally enjoyable were the other guests who were staying here -- a couple from Australia, an American living in Africa, etc. Lots of diversity, which is always great. We not only enjoyed the owners, but the sisters who served the breakfast! We were much enjoyed our stay here and would return. That said, we did stumble across a very interesting looking boutique hotel also in Sultanhamet....Sura Design Hotel. Perhaps it was the time of year, but they had lower rates and the property and its amenities appeared to be a great value for the $.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: MonctonCanucks
Reviews.Content: Ada hotel is a little gem, in the heart of Sultinahmet. Its location is ideal to walk to all the main attractions of the city: minutes away from the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Market, Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, Agia Sofia, etc. and only 20 minutes away from Attaturk AIrport. It is very clean, smoke-free, modern and is equipped with an elevator. There is a computer in the lobby reserved for guests, as well as free Wi-Fi. A printer is also available for boarding passes. We had arranged for the hotel to have us picked up at the airport. While the greeter was there, the driver did not arrive until approximately 15 minutes later. We were tired after a full day of travelling and wondered if it was a sign of things to come. At the hotel, the host and hostess first appeared reserved, but it did not take us long to discover how helpful they were and genuinely interested in our comfort. Our hostess checked us in and gave us some information about the city and the hotel as well as a tour of our room. We had reserved a standard room, but the hotel had upgraded us to a seaview room, with a jacuzzi tub. Although the room was smaller than we expected, it had all the conveniencess one could ask for: a phone with direct international access, in room safe, flat screen TV, real wine glasses, tea/coffee making facilities with real cups, etc. The linen was of good quality, with nice, plush towels. The bathroom was modern with a great shower, and very clean. The breakfast is buffet-style and taken up on the 5th floor terrasse (which is winterized!), with a beautiful view of the Marmara Sea and the cuppola of the "little mosque". It is plentiful and delicious, with a large enough selection that even after a four-night stay we were not bored with the food. We were even able to help ourselves to some juice, cereals, yogurt, etc. before our 7:00 am departure on our last day. The two young ladies who help with the preparation and service are very friendly and helpful, without hovering. If we had to say something negative, it would be that the walls are not very soundproof - as is usually the case with most small hotels - but given the type of clientele at the Ada, that is really not a problem. Final word: would we stay there again? Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parky33
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a couple of weeks ago and had a deluxe suite with a sea view, it had a hot tub and the shower had a steam facility, the room was very clean. The owners were very helpful and the location was very close to the main sights but the hotel was in a quiet street. The breakfast was good with a mix of Turkish and European foods. I'd recommend this hotel highly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Marie A
Reviews.Content: I visited twice Istanbul this year and stayed at Ada hotel. Great hotel in the center of sultan ahmet with professional and courteous service. Very clean rooms and bathrooms. Hotel offers a free pick up from the airport. The breakfast at the 5 th floor is very nice with a great & amazing view. I am going back to Istanbul in July and I will surely stay at ADA Hotel again . Thank you

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended this lovely homely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Milad C
Reviews.Content: Each room includes a Jacuzzi with a panoramic view of Marmara sea (satisfying for sea-view room lovers like me) and Sokullu Mosque. Wonderful location in the old town, delicious breakfast served at the terrace with amazing view, everything in this hotel has been selected from the best of its kind, for example handmade kilims (some kind of carpets), and very friendly manager, he even gave us a free shuttle transfer to airport and a nice small bag as farewell gift. WiFi network is free of charge, also there is a computer available in the lobby. the room was big enough for me, but do not expect to see a big hotel at all. The minibar prices are the same as outside. If you are looking for somewhere as comfortable as your home, I would recommend this hotel 100 percent!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: David E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ada Hotel during the first weekend of February, 2012 and to be honest, I can only echo all of the previous comments on this site. The room (Delux Suite) is a good size and the sea view is very pleasant - it's nice just to watch the boats lining up along the Bosperous. The hotel is very well located - quiet and yet, only a short (and generally level!) walk to key sites in the Old City. Again, as per all other reviews, the staff are very accommodating and friendly and breakfast is ample. In short, I'd highly recommend the Ada Hotel as a convenient and homely base for any trip to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place in Istanbul, Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Mimtje
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is a wonderful place to spend some days in beautiful Istanbul. It's situated in the very center of the old town (Sultanahmet), it's quiet (of course, there is a muezzin calling believers to pray every early morning, but this is part of Istanbul's soundscape) and the rooms are very clean and comfortable - the one we booked even had a jacuzzi with a great view on the marmara sea. Breakfast is served at the top of the house with the same amazing view! It offers an opulent selection of turkish dishes and continental breakfast components - you can easily combine your beloved MÃ¼esli with some exotic aubergine dishes, sausages or omelets. The owners and their staff are very friendly - and when I forgot my keys in the hotel safe they sent them immediately to my address and I had them again some three days later! I can really recommend to spend a weekend here - if I come to Istanbul again with my husband, we will definitely stay here again! February 2012

Reviews.Title: “warm place and nice people”
Reviews.Author: katharine p
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here couple days,the room was quite large and very clean,service staff were friendly,nice and warm people at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel and Amazing Hospitality!!”
Reviews.Author: marea b
Reviews.Content: The ADA Hotel is a charming boutique hotel nestled on a small and quiet cobble stone street just 2 blocks from all of the major tourist attractions in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul. Our Hosts, Havva and Dogan Sumengen were exceptionally gracious and accommodating during our entire stay. We (my husband and I and our 23 year old daughter) stayed four nights on arrival to Istanbul and were upgraded from the interconnecting triple (no views) to two separate king rooms, both with sea views. We then left Istanbul to explore other areas of Turkey and returned to the ADA for our last two nights in Turkey. Once again we were upgraded, this time to a king suite and an adjoining king room - again both with sea views. In all cases the rooms were immaculate, (this coming from a very germophobic person) the bathrooms spotless and modern with great showers, and the king beds were very comfortable. We did not need to request a wake up call because each morning between 0600 and 0630 there was the call to prayer that came from a mosque that is situated very close to the hotel. What a way to experience the amazing culture of Istanbul!! Every morning a delicious breakfast was served in a room on the fourth floor that had floor to ceiling windows with an incredible view of the sea of Marmara. Breakfast was so filling that we never felt the need to eat lunch. In the summer this room opens up to a delightful terrace for 'al fresco' dining. As mentioned, the ADA is very close to all of the major attractions of Istanbul and most of the time we were able to walk to our destinations. Walking is a great way to see, smell, and really experience this fabulous city. In a few cases we hopped on the metro which is also close to the ADA and very easy to navigate. In the evenings, when we were too exhausted to walk to dinner, Dogan called a taxi for us and alerted us to the amount we should pay the driver- which was always very reasonable. We all enjoyed our stay at the ADA and will definitely return for another stay next time we visit Turkey. And by the way, January is a great month to visit if you are prepared for the occasional rainy day and somewhat chilly weather. We were able to see ALL of the sights with NO long lines and, while there were some tourists, evidently not nearly the crowds that descend on the city during other times of the year. We highly recommend this lovely hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality at its finest”
Reviews.Author: riosteve
Reviews.Content: We came upon this small hotel on Trip Advisor. I had been to Istanbul once before and was keen to stay in the Sultanahmet district as so much of our sight-seeing would be taking place here (although not, by any means, exclusively limited to it). The hotel is run by the Sumengen family and I have yet to meet kinder, nicer people. We arrived in the "off" season (Itsanbul in Winter is definitely not for anyone who dislikes cold weather and we have had it all: rain, snow, winds and even power blackouts) and had reserved a very comfortable standard room with a view (of a minaret and a mosque) and were upgraded after a few nights to a panoramic sea view room which is extremely large and comfortable at no extra charge. The buffet breakfast is absoltely delicious, with so many options to choose from that it has taken us a while, each day, to work up an appetite for lunch. This includes at least ten different turkish dishes (in addition to eggs, bread, rools, cheeses, jams, crÃªpes) - simply unbelievable. The two young Georgian women who serve breakfast are friendly and cheerful and started our every day with a smile. If you are staying for more than three nights, you are entitled to free airport pickup (which, by the way, was British in punctuality and sped us into the city in no time flat). But the true kindness of the Sumengen family cannot be overstated. Dr and Mrs Sumengen and their children (a young man and a young woman) are Istanbul's finest calling card. The small hotel owners of my native city of Rio de Janeiro could learn VOLUMES about how to treat and care for tourists from the Sumengens. We are truly sorry to be leaving them and their beautiful city. The hotel has only one drawback and that is the absence of room service (although, to be fair, there is such an abundance of restaurants, bars and cafÃ©s in the area) that it seems almost churlish to mention this.

Reviews.Title: “A fine experience”
Reviews.Author: norman k
Reviews.Content: Great location; nice views, good service; friendly

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and service”
Reviews.Author: Amanda R
Reviews.Content: This place features a great location, wonderful views and great service. It is close to all the main historical sites, and only a short cab ride away from the modern part of the city. I would recommend it to anyone looking for an authentic experience. I would say that the only drawback is the call to prayer from the mosque across the street, which can be clearly heard in the rooms. If you are a light sleeper, this might be a nuisance, but it can also be part of the charm of being in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent People with Excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Burhan K
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 kids and my wife stayed at Ada hotel for 5 days. The Manager Doran and his wife were excellent people. The breakfast was very good. One night my 4 year old had high fever and Doran was kind enough to find a pharmacy that was open at 1 am in the morning and take me in his car to the pharmacy. They make you feel at home and part of their family. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family run boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjmegy
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! I stayed here overnight en route to the USA from West Africa. The Ada hotel was the perfect place to enjoy Istanbul. I loved it so much, I will stay there again next week on the way back to Africa. The family was incredibly kind and helpful. The hotel itself was beautiful, cosy and clean. I loved the in-room jacuzzi tub and incredible breakfast (even though I had to dash to the airport). I look very forward to returning in a few days. I highly recommend this hotel. The location is convenient, nestled in a quiet side street. The view to the mosque next door is wonderful. There is also free access to hotel computer (they are Mac users, hooray!) and allow you to make free calls to the USA and Canada. Can't beat that. I have virtually no complaints whatsoever about the Ada Hotel and will go back every time I'm in Istanbul. Thanks again for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: RogerP138
Reviews.Content: Located near many of the best attractions in Istanbul, many restaurants, and the tram for easy transport, Ada is very convenient. The breakfasts were very interesting and enjoyable, with plenty of choice. The owner is rather fussy, but obliging nevertheless. I was disturbed by the mosque's early morning call which was very close, but my wife didn't hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and a very helpful family.”
Reviews.Author: Fishanderson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ada for the New Years holiday. The rooms are small, quaint, and traditional but that's all you need whenyou're sightseeing in Istanbul. I would definitely stay there the next time I'm sightseeing in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “More than perfect”
Reviews.Author: Riyadgabrr
Reviews.Content: I use to travel to istanbul more than 15 times. But i only stayed at ada hotel for only one time ( my last visit , last dec 2011 from 5/12 till 10/12). I felt very sorry that i didnt stayed at ada hotel during my past visits to istanbul. It's a great hotel in every thing. Location, big room with a great view,clean, i felt i was at home. And a very special thanks to Dr. Dogan. You are a great man. So kind and helpfull. I wish to stay at ada hotel next visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cant beat it”
Reviews.Author: syed a
Reviews.Content: We are currently visiting Istanbul ,I am with my wife and 2 kids,my interaction with Demet on email was very good,I found him very prompt and helpful.We got here at 6:30AM,I believe check in time is either 1pm or 3pm,but when we got here our rooms were ready,and it was very helpful,at some other place we might have to either wait till afternoon or pay for an extra day to get rooms early but not here.He always gave us very good advise like told us to visit Hagha Sophia and Topkapi place without a guide and just rent audio headset from entrance which was only 10 Lira , guide would have been 100 dollars,hotel is at extremely nice location with only 2 mins to Blue Mosque and max 5 Min to TOpkapi place,its very quite and safe area.I would come back and stay here if I come to Turkey again,plus like most of Sultanhement is up and down this hotel is so close to Blue Mosque that you only have to climb one small street to get to blue mosque , other places you have to do a lot of climbing,breakfast is excellent and staff is super nice and rooms are super clean.Again I would highly recommend this place and you will not regret if you stay here .Thanks Dmet for everything

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel - Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: Norman E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week in Istanbul, staying in room 201 at the Ada Hotel which I found through trip advisor. It is a great place to stay. The room was spotlessly clean and service faultless, with an excellent buffet breakfast served on the 5th floor with a view to the Sea of Marmara. It was too cold in late November to sit outside on the terrace, which would be lovely in summer. We were collected from the airport by a minivan sent from the hotel. The hotel location is perfect, being in a quiet street, but close to the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque and in walking distance of all the main sights. Do not neglect a visit to the little Aya Sofia, (originally the church of saints Sergius & Bacchus) which is visible from the hotel and pre dates the Haghia Sofia by about 10 years. It is an architectural gem and its basic design is reflected in the Haghia Sofia itself. The nearby mosque (The Sokollu Mehmet Pasa Mosque) will wake you with its loudspeaker call to prayer, but that will happen just about anywhere you stay in Istanbul, so don't be put off. The mosque itself was designed by the great architect Sinan who was responsible for so many of Istanbul's treasures, and should be visited to see its iznik tile work

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: The_Schaefers
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Ada. The hotel is five years old and we stayed here four years ago. We were promptly collected at the airport and checked in Saturday evening. On Monday, after the weekend guests had left, the host offered to upgrade our room at no additional charge. We could have the kitchenette in the basement with its own outside door or a seaview room. We chose the kitchenette. The breakfast room is on the roof and faces the sea. The breakfast spread is incredible and ranges from sweet to savory with various egg and salad dishes. Fruits range from fresh to dried and there are several kinds of cheese. I dare you to say you can't find anything to please your palate. The WIFI has a strong signal and while I did not use it, there is a phone at the front desk for free calls to the US. The room was cleaned thoroughly every day. We would have stayed here last year, but it was full for the week we wanted. So this year I made my reservation earlier. See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Sultanahmet!!”
Reviews.Author: Xango82
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ada Hotel and we had an amazing time. I was set to come into Istanbul on November 3rd but I had to come a day earlier so I had to find a place to stay for the night since I had already made reservations for our trip at another hotel in Bakirkoy. I found the price particularly attractive so I booked it. After the one night I decided to cancel my reservations at the other hotel and just stay there. I loved the sea view from the window. I stayed in 401, I think. Although the room was a little small there is another room right next to it that is much larger and has the same great view. I would of taken that one but it was booked already. I never made it up to the roof for the breakfast so I donâ€™t know how the food was. The hotel is right around the corner from the Blue Mosque and this is THEE area to stay in while visiting Istanbul. I would have had such a different experience from this vacation if I would of stayed in Bakirkoy. The proprietors were very helpful and very attentive. The hotel was clean and had a great â€œhomeyâ€� feel to it. The only reason why I didnâ€™t give this hotel a rating of excellent is because the house keepers were a little strange. Once they came to clean the room and just threw the blanket back on the bed and didnâ€™t do anything else like give us clean glasses or clean the bathroom. But when I told the little old lady about it she made them go and clean it right away. I would love to stay there again and I would definitely recommend this hotel. Great area, great views, great owners, great time in Sultanahmet!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: EGMA1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend chose this hotel and as usual he made a nice choice. This is a great hotel in an excellent location. The hosts in this hotel were very nice, friendly and very helpful. Room was always clean, and the view from the terrace was awesome. I highly recommend this hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Neriman C
Reviews.Content: This fall Ada Hotel was home away from home to us for one week. We were welcomed by the friendly faces of owners Dr. Dogan and his lovely wife Havva, Its spotless clean and quiet rooms, nutritious buffet breakfast on the rooftop over looking the Sea of Marmara made our stay very enjoyable. This boutique hotel, located at the heart of the old Istanbul, made it easy for us to walk to many historic sites, shops and restaurants. We will definitely stay at Ada Hotel Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Super comfy place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jerry H
Reviews.Content: Incredibly comfortable beds, spotless rooms..outstanding breakfast on the terrace overlooking the sea of Marmara. The hosts were warm and made us feel right at home. Excellent location- the perfect place to stay. We will stay at the Ada again if we should ever return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Ada in October 2011”
Reviews.Author: mccarthysr
Reviews.Content: Very nice family hotel in old district. Awesome, several course breakfast on rooftop terrace. Clean rooms, helpful staff, free wi-fi, free dialing to US on lobby phone.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tripper786
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel close to all the sites, clean and friendly then Ada Hotel is for you. We stayed for 4 nights with our 2 children and loved the hotel. It only has 16 rooms so you get a personal service. Views at breakfast are unforgettable. Definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place To Stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: PetrosMarkos
Reviews.Content: By the will of God, I searched the internet and found ADA Hotel, Sultan Ahmet, Istanbul. The owner, Dr. Dogan and his family are awesome and make you feel like family. My wife and I actually booked this hotel in February of 2007 (stayed 9 nights) and were some of the first to stay in this hotel. I returned in January of 2011 (stayed 2 nights) and the hotel is just as new, as Dr. Dogan added an elevator and a dining area on the roof. The breakfast is awesome (wide variety), clean and the hotel dares you to stay, while the rest of Istanbul is tempting you. I stayed in the same room during my visits. The room is just as new: the beds are California King sized, there is a jacuzzi, plus shower; heaters/air conditioning; smells great...the view of the Bosphorous is amazing, satellite TV, phones, refrigerator, etc. I get excited just writing about it. The ADA HOTEL is a 5 STAR hotel, hands down. Dr. Dogan will arrange airport pick-up and drop-off for you, along with arranging tours or just providing tips. My first stay in Sultan Ahmet (2003) was great, but the characters at the other hotel were cold and impersonable. You'll want to live in the ADA HOTEL after your first hour here...Don't think about staying at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ozinsingas
Reviews.Content: it was my first time to istanbul and I was travelling alone as a single female. It was a pleasure stating here. Breakfasts were delicious, the room very comfortable and clean, the location very central to old istanbul sites and in a quiet cobble stoned street. The owners incredibly hospitable - all in all a wonderful stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cathie44124
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Ada Hotel for 4 nights in early October. The location was close to everything but on a quiet street with no street noise. The owners were very helpful, friendly and always available. The daily breakfasts on the rooftop terrace were phenomenal. The room was clean and comfortable. I would definitely recommend the Ada Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The service was absolutely fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Limegreen1987
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ada hotels during September 2011. The staff were fantastic. The owners were very friendly and very helpful. They helped us book day trips and were very reasonably priced. The rooms are very clean and tidy, beds are comfortable and the sheets are very soft!! The breakfast is absolutely amazing, serving anything you could dream of!! It's on the top floor of the hotel. The terresse overlooks the mosque and is open all day. It's lovely to watch the sunset. Location is very central and walking distance to all the attractions in the area.

Reviews.Title: “We were well looked after”
Reviews.Author: Joan O
Reviews.Content: I was one of a party of three teachers from South Africa who visited Turkey in July 2011. We ladies are all in our early sixties. What Dr. Sumengen did for us was incredible. We eventually referred to him as our â€œfairy godfatherâ€�!! On arrival we were met at the Istanbul airport with no hassle and taken to the Ada Hotel, where he changed our money so we were able to dump our luggage in our room (very clean and comfortable with complimentary water and soft drinks) and go shopping immediately! Here I must make mention of the fact that the Ada is within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosque and Haggia Sophia and is right in the heart of the Old Istanbul. Regarding looking after his guests, this man is an expert â€“ he booked and organized transport to a kebab restaurant, pointed us in the right direction for a day trip to the Black Sea, organized and booked our transport to and hotel accommodation (lovely!) in Cappadocia and Ephesus as well as three excellent day tours, AND phoned us along the way to find out if everything was to our liking and if we were okay. Oh wow! Long live â€œthe godfatherâ€�! On our return to Istanbul before flying home, we were upgraded to a luxury suite. When we asked to have our final meal at a fish restaurant, he booked it for us and sorted out the transport. Next day he organized the free shuttle to the airport, helped us with our luggage and waved goodbye. This man may be a chemical engineer and ex lecturer at the University of Ankara, but he certainly knows his â€œstuffâ€� in the hotel trade!! The Ada Hotel is for real people. People who want to have a safe haven to come back to after being â€œout thereâ€� shopping and looking and walking and listening and eating and breathing in the whole â€œthingâ€� that is Istanbul! And for people who enjoy breakfast. Those Ada breakfasts are something else â€“ enhanced by the fact that one gets to partake of them on the fourth floor roof patio of the hotel with a view over the sea. A big thank you to Dr. Sumengen, his wife and the two delightful young ladies who assist them in the running of this fine hotel by keeping the rooms spotless and obviously working very hard in the catering department. I have read some of the reports about the Ada (seems most people enjoyed it as much as we did!) and all I can say to the people who made negative comments is: GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!! That way you will give more opportunities to people like me to not find this wonderful oasis of kindness in the heart of Istanbul, fully booked! Go well â€¦

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and very friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: laluchicago
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and our son) stayed for a week at Ada. We had a quiet and beautiful family suite on the street level. Spotless and the owner was always very response to even a minor issue. Breakfast was fantastic - i counted once 35 different items....beautiful views from the terrace. Just the right way to start a day of sightseeing. WiFi included. The Airport shuttle was very convenient. Excellent location for visiting all hi lites. We'll be back....

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, top-notch service”
Reviews.Author: irishrep
Reviews.Content: We are so happy we chose Ada Hotel for our trip in September! It was one of the few things that went right about the whole experience of having our wedding in Istanbul. We stayed in three other hotels across the country, and this was by far the best. Here's what we loved: - The service! The owner was the friendliest, most helpful person we met in all of Turkey (we found most people we encountered were rude or indifferent...service is not a strong point in the country). We got married on a boat on the Bosphorous, and the owner made sure we had a honeymoon-type experience at his hotel. He even upgraded us to a bigger room for free two nights and paid for our tux/wedding dress to be pressed as a "gift." Remarkable! He recommended a great fish restaurant as well. The two women who clean the rooms work extremely hard. They might seem grumpy at first, but they are very sweet. Just flash them a smile. One of them even hugged and kissed me on the cheek when we were leaving. They do a tremendous job at cleaning the rooms, too. They'll fold your clothes and put in a bunch of other personal touches. The owner's wife was very sweet as well, and if you come up a little late for breakfast she will get you something even if they've already cleared everything away. - The location:Just minutes from all the top sites. And, just as importantly, a short walk to the main tram that will get you to Taksim Square. Additionally, there are tons of restaurants and bars within a 5-10 minute walk. Word of warning: The cab drivers have NO IDEA where they are going half the time. Everyone in our wedding party had numerous difficulties with cabs. They have a particularly hard time finding the Ada. So carry a printout with the name, address and phone number of the hotel (although even with that they will still drive around for an extra 20 minutes trying to find the place). Once you get the lay of the land you can walk easily everywhere in the Old Quarter and beyond. - The rooftop patio. Oh, man. We will miss sitting up there for breakfast and a late-night drink. Great view, very relaxing and amazingly quiet at night. You can just stare out to the water and over the city and not hear a peep for most of the nights. Excellent. - The food: They only serve breakfast here, but it is an amazing spread. I have no idea what half of it is, but it's all pretty good. It does get a little repetitive (we were there for seven nights) but you can always find something (egg dishes, hot meats, etc). The chicken nuggets are an odd choice, yet for some reason I got one every morning. As for the rooms, we felt they were a little hit-or-miss. The panoramic seaview rooms look bigger on the website than they are in reality. You are essentially paying a lot more for the view and the bathtub near the window compared with the budget suite. That's fine, but the rooms are smaller than the ones on the bottom floors/basement. We found the room pretty tight, but we eventually upgraded to the Ottoman Suite and that was really nice and spacious. Highly recommended, if you can afford it. If not, the budget suite is a good option. Some of our friends stayed in these rooms on the lower levels and they were similar in size to the Ottoman Suite and very cool on hot days. Not having a view is not a huge deal, as the rooftop patio is always accessible. In general, you can't really go wrong here, it just depends on your needs and budget. Another note: the morning prayer will wake you up no matter which room you're staying in, as there are about six speakers on a mosque right near the hotel. But that is part of the experience! One general tip: Be careful when someone tells you how far things are from the area (except for places in Sultanhamet). We were told numerous times by several people that it only takes 10 minutes in a cab to get to Taksim Square. We had to go back and forth every day, and it only took 10 minutes once. Times ranged from 20 minutes to 45 minutes to a disaster of a night (rehearsal dinner) in which it took almost two hours in terrible traffic! We were very late for the dinner and almost missed it entirely. We were told it would only take 15-20 minutes in traffic. So be careful when planning. It takes about 45 minutes total on the tram (including walking to the station and transferring at Kabatash Port), but it's extremely reliable. Feel safe in booking this hotel. We had seven other family members/friends stay with us and we all loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel a few minutes from the main touristic sites of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: raphetcaro
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel... and perfect service! Our room was very comfortable: large double bed, little kitchen with fridge and complimentary tea and coffee, bathroom with bathtub ("bubble" bathtub). Very clean. But the best was the terrace and the gorgeous view over the minars and the sea of Marmara! It was so relaxing and charming to sit there after a day visiting the city, to listen to the Muezzin while watching the boats slowly coming back to the harbour... what a moment. The blue mosque and Haghia Sophia is a mere 10 minutes walk away. The hotel area is very quiet. And last but not least, the hotel manager was very kind and helpful, he made his best to help us out for the rest of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fabiano O
Reviews.Content: As a single traveler I stayed for one night at this very nice hotel. The room is small, but confortable, very clean, with a wonderful view to the sea. The calling to prayers at 5 AM from a nearby mosque was already expected, but it was short and did not bother at all. Breakfast is very good, served on a terrace with view to the sea. It takes a 5 min walk to get to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. I certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to all the sites in the old town”
Reviews.Author: blonddog
Reviews.Content: Great reception by owners who do everything to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Close walk to all the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Personal service par excellence”
Reviews.Author: edna_aquino
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in Turkey . There were four of us - two couples - and three are first-time visitors to Turkey. Ada Hotel has done a great job for Turkish tourism for their great hospitality. Although the rooms are tiny (we had the regular sized bedroom) - they are superbly clean. There is an adjacent private kitchenette which we seldom used but will be good for long-stayers and travelling on budget. Breakfast is local Turkish - offering a variety of home-cooked fare. The best attraction of course are its terrace overlooking the Marmara and the dome / minaret of one of the smaller Turkish mosques in Sultanhamet and most of all - the couple who own and run the place. They['re former academics and have chosen to run this hotel as their retirement pre-occupation. Theyre doing it for the love of it which means that you get a personal touch and their English proficiency comes very hand. It's also walking distance from the major attractions of the old town Sultanhamet so no worries about coming home late or coming back inthe middle of your day tour to unload your shopping bags or to take a nap.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying there and I plan to stay there again, should I will be in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Alfred G
Reviews.Content: The owners, which are permanently available to you, eager to help and to assist you in any situation are very kind and warm people. The room we stayed in, was very confortable, with a big bad, a sofa, an armchair, three chairs, a table and a desk, an wardrobe containing and a safe, an iron and a ironing table. There are in also a big fridge, a chitken closet whith everything you need to make a coffe or tea, a microwave oven and surprise, a jacuzzi inside the room. The bath room is also new and nice. You get a big lcd tv set and a dvd player in the room and wireless internet acces. Everything in the room is in a excelent condition and well functioning. The breakfast is very good with a many choices and is served in a very nice view of Bosforus on the roof terase. In the entrance lobby there are an internet acces computer for the guest use. Finally the location is in the heart of old SultanAhmed district near the Istambul most important atractions. As an conclusion we had a very nice stay there, that's why we extended it for few days more and compared with condition in "ARDEN" five stars hotel in the nearby, there are a big difference in the advantage of ADA. The entrance is not impresive, is looking like a regular house entry, more than a hotel one, the entrance lobby also, but don't be fooled by this as we've been and don't judge by first impression, you'll see, will have a nice time there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: caroline d
Reviews.Content: Dogan and Havva provide a most wonderful simple sanctuary in Istanbul. A few blocks walk from all the activity it's a quiet oasis. Comfortable, spotless and well-loved with dark wood classic furniture, turkish rugs and views. They genuinely care about each one of their guests and are pleasantly present. ~ Of no small note is the delicious breakfast - a smorgasbord of fresh Turkish and European offerings - crepes, frittata, eggplant, zucchini, lentil dishes, granola, tomatoes, cheese, fruit juices, baklava... and more! It's no secret I turned breakfast into brunch and was healthfully fortified until dinner time. The breakfast is served on a sunny tranquil rooftop with a magnificent view over mosques to the water. Traveling solo I shared breakfast several times with other Ada Hotel guests. Other days I enjoyed simply reflecting on my trip and the day ahead. ~ A great plus is that Dogan arranges tours all around the country. He set me up in small groups of five people with engaging and knowledgable English-speaking guides. Each bus and hotel were planned beautifully. Traveling solo it was the perfect way to see many of Turkey's best sites in 4 days. ~ Another bonus is they will upgrade your room if it's available. ~ It was extremely helpful to have free internet access. ~ The free ride to and from the airport at any hour is very welcoming to weary travelers. ~ I can honestly say it was one of the most enjoyable stays I've ever had. I returned to Istanbul for a second stay at the end of my trip!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantasticâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: rania s
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel two times,it is in the central location,staff fully takes care of you and is one of the most welcoming,the room is very comfortable and quiet sleep,people are very friendly and helpful,absolutely fantasticâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Great location. Great rooms. Great view.”
Reviews.Author: kentkleiman
Reviews.Content: Ada hotel was exceeded my expectations. The location is a 5 min walk to the Blue Mosque (and you don't need to be a mountain climber to get there, like some hotels). The views from the roof terrace, and many of the rooms,were spectacular. An almost unobstructed view of the sea of marmara (the obstruction is a beautiful Byzantine era church/mosque ruins across the street that are lovely in themselves). The service is great. The couple that owns the hotel, a retired professor and teacher, are kind and helpful and cetainly make you feel at home. The rooms were immaculate. They were clean and modern and had many modern conveniences (from large flat screen TVs to big whirlpool tubs). My wife and I were so pleased, we decided to return at the end of our travels around Turkey for a second stay. We figured that we couldn't find a better value in all Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Kids still talk about it!”
Reviews.Author: Megan G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very central and very clean. The service was excellent and the staff always available and willing to help you with anything. If you wanted something it was always possible! Being a husband and wife team with delightful girls working with them gave this place a special touch. My two little girls still talk about the Ada hotel being the best experience of Istanbul with Havva (wife) playing with them on the computer and hugging and kissing them all the time. Six weeks later they pulled up a photo of her on my phone and both said "Havva" with absolute genuine love in their voices. With the best breakfast in town to top it off, it would be insane for us to go back and stay anywhere else. We will be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best-run family-owned hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: canyak
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Ada Hotel was warm and, at points, spectacular. The view from every window was framed by the sparkling Marmara Sea (we stayed on the fourth floor in the sea-view room) and the room itself was clean and well-presented. Perhaps best of all is the staff, who make the whole experience feel like a trip to visit family. Given that the prices could be considered only slightly above budget, this hotel should definitely be considered. It offers an authentic Turkish experience in a small hotel that is well-situated and excellently run.

Reviews.Title: “We sure loved it and will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Sajjad_73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, pristine and boutique in real sense of the word. The management and staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and Well kept Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgenking
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Ada Hotel. It was very centrally located to a number of historical sites and an easy walk to public transportation. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Every morning we would have breakfast on the rooftop with a great view of marmara. The rooms were nice, well kept and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Guest house more than hotel but quirky nice !”
Reviews.Author: Frankie098
Reviews.Content: Ada Hotel Istanbul Donâ€™t expect anything impersonal when booking the Ada, much more like being in a guest in someoneâ€™s house. Great location, so close to everything, friendly hosts, quirky dÃ©cor, very comfortable bed with amazing view over the roofs to the water, fantastic array of food for breakfast (rooftop terrace) with home cooked dishes a favourite. Dogan gave us good restaurant addresses and on departure we received small gifts and free transfer to airport (return) as we stayed 9 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and we will most certainly be back!”
Reviews.Author: mia070
Reviews.Content: We were picked up at the airport by the driver courtesy the Ada hotel. The hotel is perfectly located in the Old City, close to everything, We had the double room with a jacuzzi and a panoramic view of the Sea of Marmara and the Sukulla Mehmet Pasha Mosque. Beautiful! The service at this hotel was excellent; rooms are cleaned daily, fresh towels daily, bottled water provided, along with wine glasses, coffee, tea, and all sorts of excellent little touches. The breakfast was amazing! Jenna, Mya, and Nina, along with the owner's wife, Mrs Sumengen, create a breakfast to delight a sultan! The variety and the freshness of everything on offer was really impressive. The owners, Mr and Mrs Sumengen, were gracious and caring hosts; we felt very welcome, and very well taken care of. The hotel and area felt exceedingly safe. In fact, I felt safer in Istanbul than in my home city. We met friends of ours in Istanbu,l who were at a hotel not far from ours. Their hotel was only ok; and they envied our choice of the Ada, (and our incredible breakfast!). Here are some excerpts from my travel diary: July 15th: Woke very early in the dark to the sound of a very beautiful chanting with a soft chorus that steadily grew stronger, which was this morning's mezzin ( call to prayer). I got up, and opened the windows wide, and looked out at the mineret and the mosque; there was a beautiful golden full moon right over the mosque. Beautiful Istanbul. Lights from the the boats on the sea of Marmara. Beautiful, beautiful Istanbul. Outside of our window is the Sukulla Mehmet Pasha Mosque, and an ancient ruin of a Byzantine church with an old and overgrown garden that is filled with birds that we hear every morning. The mourning doves are especially lovely. The air is filled with bird song. We have large windows that open inward, and the sea breezes waft into our room. We sleep very well here. Last night as we were coming back to the hotel, a man walking down the cobblestone street was carrying a huge silver tray that was piled high with pastries and breads and buns, still warm from baking. "Madame, Madame'" he called to me. I bought a delicious bun filled with melting feta cheese for 2 lira. The bazaars are fun. The shop keepers call out to me as I pass, " You can spend your money here Madame: I have beautiful things to show you; come and have tea and see my shop; welcome; over here..." . They are charming, and mostly mischievous, and full of fun. I laugh and thank them and say no. They bow and say, " you are very kind ", or call out, " where are you from", or say, "you are breaking my heart", with a hand on their chest, a bow, and laughing eyes. I think this is the best holiday we've ever had. This hotel was certainly the right move! This is the first time I've ever realized how the right hotel can add so much to your experience of your trip. We should have found a hotel like this when we were in Paris! So, in closing this review, I wish to say: Istanbul, this most ancient city, is full of gracious, warm, and charming people. The Ada hotel, and Istanbul, are so very highly and warmly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull location and stunning view”
Reviews.Author: sheshoedai
Reviews.Content: we stayed in hotel ADA during 3 days. it is very well located for the tourist attractions and offers a very personal service. the owners are always there to give advice and the breakfast on the roof with a stunning view is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Trihard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ada hotel for 6 nights and loved it. The proprietors are extremely hospitable, upgrading us to a larger room for the second half of our stay. The location is great. Very close to the Hippodrome but at the same time very quiet, unlike some places behind the Blue Mosque where you will find a great majority of the Sultanahmit hotels. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and the breakfast on the terrace exquisite.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home, genuine and sincere hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Bouloys
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four day stay at the Ada Hotel Istanbul, they exceeded our every expectation. Firstly, our flight was three hours late and when we finally emerged from the arrivals gate, we were overjoyed to see their representative there waiting for us. Secondly, when I paid the bill it was calculated at the current days bank exchange rate for US$. Due to the currency fluctuations this actually lowered my bill by US$13.00, not much, but in principle it's not often that you encounter such a degree of fairness in any type of transaction. Furthermore, the warmth conveyed toward the guests made us feel as if we were truly at home. The breakfast had a large variety of offerings to satisfy both kids and adults alike. The hotel accomodated our family of two adults and three teenagers very well, it was very safe, it was spotless and the view from the roof was awe inspiring. They even offered free calls to the US and Canada, unbelievable! It is also very conveniently located and within walking distances of many of the areas attractions. I would definitely stay here again and would not hesitate in recommending the hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best in 40 years of international travel”
Reviews.Author: tammy091
Reviews.Content: Great location and easy walk distance 3-8 blocks to the major sites. Excellent breakfast with huge array of items in the buffet to be consumed on the rooftop terrace overlooking the sea. Newly built and all new furnishings, comfy bed, fresh fine linens each day spotless cleaning daily. Owner gave good tips and helped to arrange things. Free 24 hour phone to us and also internet wireless. Great and friendly staff. Will always return to this hotel and recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Bronte19
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to be recommended this hotel and it was perfect. We stayed here on 2 occasions and when we went back the second time it was like going home. The Dr and his wife and daughter could not be more helpful or hospitable and always accommodated our change of dates, rooms etc with patience and grace. The location is really convenient but quiet, except of course for the mosque but you get used to this. All the Doctor's recommendations for restaurants were excellent and we were very sad to leave. The breakfast is also delicious with different things every day and the setting for this, looking over the water, is lovely. There is also plunger Starbuck's coffee at breakfast which was much appreciated. Staying here really made our time in Istanbul and we wil certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy and will return”
Reviews.Author: BandG1718
Reviews.Content: Our room was exceptionally comfortable, with a jacuzzi and hi-tech shower. The king bed was excellent. Our view of the Sea of Marmara was breathtaking and ever-changing. Located in the heart of the old city, we could walk to many of the key historical sites and museums in Istanbul. The breakfast, taken on the top floor of the hotel with a beautiful view, was excellent. Our hosts, the owners, were very helpful with directions, maps and guides, and transportation. All in all, we were delighted with the Ada Hotel and look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Treatment by the Owners”
Reviews.Author: BCCampbells
Reviews.Content: The owner was very helpful when he welcomed us and took us to the room. He was available most of the time in the lobby for questions and recommendations. His wife puts out a breakfast buffet with a great deal or variety that was very good. We had the triple room with a separate single bedroom which worked out well for our daughter. The bathroom is a little tight in this room, but other than that it the room was great. The location is terrific as you are at the top of the hill when the main attractions are and can walk to the main square in the middle in 5 minutes. I would highly recommend staying at ADA.

Reviews.Title: “Warmly reccomended:-)))”
Reviews.Author: DesiPingelova
Reviews.Content: We stay at Ada Hotel in february with friends - very kindly and hospitable peoples! The great location, very good, home made breakfast and service! The owner, Mr. Dogan help to us for all our needs and inquaries! Warmly reccomended:-)))

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: schobby
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a simple, yet very comfortable, affordable hotel in the old city of Isantabul, I would recommend the Ada Hotel. It is more like a well done Pension but the room we stayed in was clean, comfortable and had some nice ammmenities you might not expect in a place that size. Included was a jetted tub, flat screen TV and a view of the bay out your front window. the breakfast that was included was exceptional, as well. It was only a few blocks away from the Blue Mosque and other attractions in the old city - very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Buia59
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the ADA hotel. The location is excellent. Blue mosque is only five minutes walk. Through my bedroom windows I could see the sea of marmara, an old mosque and an old Byzantinian ruin. Breakfast on the terrace was delicious. A good combination of Turkish and western food. The view from the terrace is magnificent. What we loved most is the personal touch. ADA hotel is family owned and Dr. Sumengen and his wife greated us everyday at the breakfast and attended to our personal needs. It felt like we were staying with our own family. The hotel is very clean and the staff very friendly. The only thing that bothered me was the jacuzzi in the bedroom that was sticking out at one end. But my overall experience was great and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A PRECIOUS LITTLE STAR IN STAMBUL”
Reviews.Author: viajjante
Reviews.Content: Ada Hotel is a excellent guest house with peace, comfort and tranquility Ada Hotel is a place for people of good taste. feel the real turquish hospitality . It is a little gold gem in Sultanamet The Ownwer is a gentleman, calm and patient wirh guest. He is so nice person and all his tips about restaurants were wonderfull. The room was comfortable , very clean and everithing was ok. Good hot shower. Breakfast was excellent with wonderfull view to Bosphorus The hotel is close to all major tourist attractions but in calm street. If you are looking for a hotel to feel comfortable with discription and personality this is a place for your stay. . So, this is a small hotel with a great service and excellent value for money I will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “It is a Gem”
Reviews.Author: Agnes020
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel in the heart of Blue Mosque is really what I was looking for. Clean, friendly, and extremely helpful

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience Of My 24 Day Vacation.”
Reviews.Author: konakai2
Reviews.Content: Staying at this quaint boutique hotel in Istanbul, was the best part of my 24 day vacation. The (very knowledgeable and caring) owner and manager of the hotel was delightfully helpful with pre-arranging tours, dining out, getting money exchanged, and co-ordinating every detail of our Cappadocia tour, as well. The breakfasts and scenery off the breakfast nook was fantastic. I recommend this hotel very highly. Oh...and a welcome perk for everyone at this small hotel, was that there were free phone calls to the U.S. in the main lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: IslaBonita77
Reviews.Content: With the sheer amount of small, family-run hotels in Istanbul, I felt lucky to have booked the Ada. We were in a few different locations in Turkey, and I always try to stay in more modest places at first and save up for a bit of a splurge at the end of our trips. The Ada felt like a splurge since it is so well-appointed, but reasonable price made it a great value instead of a bank account drain! We had an impeccably clean deluxe room with a comfortable king bed, a working flat-screen TV with several English channels, a panoramic view of the Maramar Sea with a jacuzzi at the window and a standing shower with about 6 different options including steam. The breakfast was one of the best and most extensive I have had with Western options of crepes, several kinds of eggs, pancakes, french toast, together with Turkish-style cheeses, vegetables and sweets. This was unexpected given the small size of the hotel. That breakfast in the morning or a glass of wine or beer (ask Dr. Dogan who keeps some on site) at sunset can be enjoyed indoors or out on the roof-top terrace is an added bonus. As others have mentioned, it is close to all sites in the Old City. It is true that it may take a bit to find it when you first arrive, but the streets in Istanbul are poorly marked in general with hotels scattered all through the area. It took some time, but we were able to find it coming off the train with a map and a little help from the locals. Once found, you will appreciate that it is a bit off the main area (making it more quiet) though still on a very safe street. We walked home in the wee hours of the morning and always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “gracious hosts and excellent position”
Reviews.Author: chalkie62
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Ada Hotel made our long weekend in Istanbul all the more memorable. The hosts were so friendly and helpful. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace was spectacular, overlooking the Marmara Sea and a Byzantine mosque ruin. The breakfast buffet was excellent and extensive with both western and turkish food. ALL the workers at the hotel were super friendly. We stayed in the triple room on the second floor which was quite cramped, no view but it was clean. We didn't come to Istanbul to sit in our hotel room. All the main attractions are minutes away by foot. blue mosque, aya sophia, the Hamam, grand bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfectly Good Hotel, But Not Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Austinex
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th visit to Turkey and I usually stay in Istanbul at the beginning and end of each trip. On one end of my trip I always stay at a favorite hotel of mine, but sometimes try a new hotel at the other end. This was the case with the Ada Hotel and I chose it primarily based on reviews on Tripadvisor. My take on the hotel is a bit different from the other reviews that I have read. It seems to me that most of those reviewers are first time visitors to Istanbul and many of the things that they praise so highly are really fairly standard features for all of the small family run hotels in Sultanahmet -- breakfast terrace with amazing views, nice breakfast spread, small but comfortable rooms, friendly and hospitable staff. I would be severely disappointed if I *didn't* find those features in an Istanbul hotel. That said, the Ada Hotel does have a larger than usual selection of breakfast items, all very tasty. Dr. and Mrs. Sumengen are indeed very knowledgeable about Istanbul and able to provide visitors with useful information, but they assume that every is a first time visitor and provided brochures and suggestions that I really didn't need. But there were a few things which kept me from being as positive about the hotel as other reviewers. One is location -- as a previous review mentioned, taxi drivers can't find the hotel, and even when they do (with phone instructions from the owner), they can't actually get there if there is heavy traffic. I had to get out of my taxi and scout out the location of the hotel, then carry two bags and a carry-on up two steep blocks to the hotel. Another problem was the wifi -- it worked fine the first night, but never did on subsequent days. There were several different wifi networks for the hotel, but they would disappear and reappear, seemingly at random. The last issue is the air conditioning. Like many of the smaller hotels in Turkey, there is an AC unit in each room, but the units themselves are fixed to not allow the guest to set the temperature below a certain point. At the Ada Hotel, that point was too warm for me, as I prefer to sleep in a cool room. In May it was acceptable, but I imagine that in August it would be a different situation. In summary, I would say that the Ada Hotel is a very good hotel, but not really an outstanding one.

Reviews.Title: “Love to go back”
Reviews.Author: Trader48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Ada Hotel, Istanbul in early May, 2011, and I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. The hotel is conveniently located in the Sultanahmet area and is a short walk to many sights of interest. The owners, Dr. Dogan and Hanna are gracious hosts and went out of their way to ensure that our stay was memorable. Their recommendations for restaurants, a Turkish bath/massage, shopping, sightseeing, etc.,were excellent, and the hotel seems to be their labour of love. Our good-sized room with Jacuzzi overlooked a mosque and the Bosphorous. Given the reports I had read that the Sultanahmet area was noisy, our room was surprisingly quiet (aside from the early morning call to prayer). This is a great place to serve as a base for exploring Istanbul. In addition, the owners operate a travel agency and will book tours and make arrangements to visit other parts of Turkey. We'd love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, clean hotel with very hospitable owners”
Reviews.Author: abhimahajan
Reviews.Content: Despite reaching late, our host Dr Sumangen Dohan received us with a smile and showed us to our nice room. The room was well appointed and was well stocked with coffee,tea etc. There was an opportunity to use the Jacuzzi in the room overlooking the Marmara sea, but sights and sounds of Istanbul hardly left us with any spare time to try it. The view from our room through the long windows was fabulous. We had the constant company of Sokullu Mehmet Pasa mosque and its minarets that are beautifully lighted at night. We could also take in all the happenings in the Marmara sea from our room. The goings on inside a stork family nest, on the pillar outside at the corner of the sokak also kept us entertained. We started our days with hearty breakfasts that included freshly made pancakes and olives with goats cheese. You could also get eggs in their various guises at request. There was baclava and other sweet things to indulge your sweet tooth. Mrs Hawa Dohan personally supervised the breakfast arrangements each morning. Breakfast room is on the top floor adjacent to the terrace with sweeping views of central istanbul and Marmara sea especially at its most evocative when night falls. We could not have asked for a better location to take in all the attractions of the old town. The blue mosque is virtually on your doorstep and Hagia Sophia not much further. You also have a good choice of restaurants and eateries nearby. Best of all, Dr Sumengen Dohan and his wife Hawa make wonderful hosts. They are very approachable and are a mine of information about all things Istanbul and Turkey. They also run a tourist agency that could organise further explorations of the Anatolian plateau should you wish to do so. We had a very pleasant and comortable stay at Hotel Ada and would happily recommend it to anyone wanting a fantastic value for money place to stay in the old part of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: Nihatu
Reviews.Content: Awesome experience. Great location. Comfy bed, clean bathroom, good water pressure. The most kind and attentive hosts...Dr. and Mrs. Sumengen were soo nice to our 4 year old, they even called us in our room when we were late waking up one morning and said they would keep everything out until we ate. The transfers to the airport were very efficiently arranged. I will definitely go back to Ada Hotel in my next family visit to Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Like family”
Reviews.Author: Nihatu
Reviews.Content: Dr. Sumengen and Mrs. Sumengen are definitely in the right business. We visited for six nights with our 4 year old daughter. The room was spotless, we went with a three person room however, we all slept together in one the large comfy bed with perfect pillows and just left our luggage in the attached room with the single. The bathroom was super clean with excellent water pressure for the shower, hot and cold water very reliable.We were given detailed and very helpful instruction about things to do while in Istanbul. The table was always full of options and delivious. What made the stay exceptional was when we woke up late one morning and thought we were going to have to skip breakfast, Dr. Sumengen called our room saying he didn't see us for breakfast and would keep everything out until we had breakfast, what more can you expect from a host? They were so kind and gentle with our daughter, it was like visiting her grandparents. Finally, on the day we departed, transport to the airport was smoothly arranged and they walked us over to the van, and so us off with such genuine affection, it felt like we were being seen of by family. The only thing they can work on is having consistent Wifi during the day, it was perfect in the evenings although, don't expect most travelers to be cooped up in their hotel room during the day. Without a doubt in my mind, I will be going back to Ada Hotel on my next trip to Istanbul, a beautiful city with warm, generous, kind people.

Reviews.Title: “Fine introduction to Istanbul and Turkey”
Reviews.Author: r_agius
Reviews.Content: The Ada Hotel Istanbul is a very good introduction to Turkey. The rooms are spacious, very comfortable and include a wide range of resources. The hotel is ideally located in a pleasing area and within walking distance of major attractions. In addition the owners are more like friends anxious to make your stay as pleasant as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Excelletn location, amazing views and lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bestuzhev
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went to Turkey f1 GP and after a long research bofore going there we choose this hotel. Definitely it's the best decision!!! Amazing location and great view from the our room on the 4th floor. Room exactly how described and pictured in the website. Very clean, nice service from the staff. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel where the owners go the extra mile.”
Reviews.Author: davidb02
Reviews.Content: The Ada hotel is within walking distance of many of the sights of old Istanbul and the breakfast room and some of the rooms have great views of the Sea of Marmara. However what makes the hotel really special is that Dr. Sumangen's and his wife's attention to detail to ensure that their guests' every wish is accommodated. They are always in the hotel to make sure that the guests are happy We asked Dr. Sumangen to organise a tour of Turkey, which he did with great care and attention to detail. The trip ran like clockwork and the other hotels he found for us were generally of similar quality to his own. When we returned for our last night at the Ada hotel, we were greeted like returning members of the family. We will certainly get Dr Sumangen to arrange another tour and stay with him again.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Friendly Hotel with perfect location and great views”
Reviews.Author: sparkybuddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on vacation in Turkey and stayed at Ada Hotel for 3 nights after driving through much of the central and western parts of the country. We were very happy with Ada Hotel. The proprietor is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The room was clean and neat (though on the small side). We were on the 3rd floor and had a wonderful view of an old crumbling column, a mosque and the sea of Marmara. An enchanting view. We had room 302; the room next to us was much bigger; if you need more room you could ask for that one. The terrace has a stunning view of the sea and the breakfast served each morning there on the terrace was one of the best we had during our three weeks in Turkey. The location is great, it is within an easy walk to the hippodrome, the Blue Mosque, Haiga Sophia (the highlight of our stay in Istanbul), etc. It is also close to a tram stop if you wish to explore further without walking. The only cons I can think of is that it was a bit hard to find; they could use a more prominent sign. Also the internet on the third floor was weak. But there is a computer in the lobby that guests are free to use and the internet in the lobby is strong. In summary, a great place to stay while in Istanbul with a very friendly owner who will be sure to do everything possible to make your visit a success.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a few rough edges.”
Reviews.Author: chloeioana
Reviews.Content: This is not exactly a criticism but the hotel is somewhat more eccentric than reviews led me to believe and this might not be what everyone is looking for in a hotel. The owner's insistence on showing guests how every little thing in the room works (volume control on the TV remote, for instance) means that guests wanting to check-in or out were often left waiting a long time. Also, there was only one small plunger of coffee for all the guests which was refreshed irregularly so out of four days I only got to have coffee with my breakfast once. Finally, the daily cleaning of the room was not great and unfortunately the room was left with a strong body-odour smell. Don't get me wrong, it's a great hotel in a great location, but perhaps not as professionally run as you might expect/want.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in great location with welcoming owners who make you feel like home”
Reviews.Author: adventurefamilyMn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding in so many ways. The owners were very helpful and their hospitality showed in the way they welcomed us like family to their hotel and helped us with touring, directions and transportation. The breakfast was delicious and the view from the top of the hotel where breakfast was served was amazing. The location was perfect and allowed us to walk or take public transportation around the city with ease. The rooms were clean and very comfortable and perfect for a family. The call to prayer woke us up in the very early morning in the beginning of our stay but by the end of the visit it was apart of what we liked. Thank you for making our stay so great.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: kjhlaughlin
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy 5 star place but the rooms are clean, comfortable, and the hotel is in an incredible location. Just minutes from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, it's also just about a 10 minute walk to the Grand Bazar. There are many restaurants within in walking distance, as well as the city metro.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money at a great location with great roof terrace with view on the Marmar Sea”
Reviews.Author: mavawie
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel, as it seemed value for money according to tripadvisor. It turned out to be exactly that. We were upgraded from a standard room to a room with a marvelous view on the Marmar Sea.
