Even though the rooms are not top modern, they are clean and equiped with everything you need to enjoy your city trip incl. complementary water, coffee and tea. Breakfast ist being served at the top floor (there is an elevator) and offers a lot of (turkish and continental) choices incl. pancakes. You can choose to sit on the roof terrace, where you can enjoy a great view on the Marmar Sea. There is free wireless and a pc you can use (so you could check-in online and the print your ticket). The owner and staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is situated in walking distance of the blue mosque and the grand bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Erum_Khalid
Reviews.Content: We were 4 ladies stayed there for 3 nights. An excellent small hotel. Very close to the main sights in the best part of Istanbul. Close to tram station. Beautiful views from breakfast terrace. Big and comfortable rooms with jaccuzi and attached kitchen to make tea. What really sets it apart is its friendly and very helpful owner . He would help us with everything like calling a cab for us, informing us about the approximate cab fare, making reservation at a nice resturant and a turkish hamam.Would definitely stay again."â€Ž One downside is that the cab drivers from other areas of istanbul could never find it. We always had to get off at the blue mosque then walk(5min) from there which is not bad. -Erum Khalid

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live in that hotel!”
Reviews.Author: morrisonheidi
Reviews.Content: The beautiful view, the kind people, the delicious breakfast every morning.....it had a feel that will always be in my when I think of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough though not recommended for very young children”
Reviews.Author: hochy1948
Reviews.Content: To start on a positive note the owners were very helpful and approachable and the hotel is very well kept and clean, the rooms are cleaned very well every day. The breakfast was pretty good though there wasn't a highchair to be found. I would not recommend this hotel to families with very young children. I think the enjoyment of this hotel must depend on the room considering all the other great reviews however we were disappointed with our 'suite' room 204 which we found quite small despite being expensive. The room was stiflingly hot even though it was Spring and cool outside. The windows didn't open properly. We were also underneath the dining terrace and could hear the breakfast tables and chairs being moved very early in the morning. There was hammering and drilling during the day on the terrace which was heard very clearly in our room and made it difficult to relax with our 8 month old son, to be fair they stopped after I complained. The curtains in the room did not cover the windows so the room became very light in the early hours. I was hoping to be able to prepare some baby food in the 'kitchenette' though it was just a cupboard with tea and coffee facilities. Don't be put off if you don't have kids as it is a good location, though I don't think you need to pay the extra for the suite as there isn't a great difference in accommodation and a large difference in price.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest hotels anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: smorr53467
Reviews.Content: I will begin by stating how impressed I was with the kindness and conscientiousness of the proprietors, Dr. Dogan Sumengen and his wife. They went to great lengths to make us feel welcome and assist in any of our needs as tourists. My adult daughter and I were in Istanbul for one week and originally had made reservations with a hotel that did not meet our expectations. We went on Rick Steves' web page and found a recommendation to Hotel Ada and called in the morning of our second day and within 3 hours we were at Hotel Ada and checked in for the week. The hotel and room were beautiful, with our room not only overlooking the Bosphorus Strait, but with a personal jacuzzi. The breakfast, included with room, was delicious. The service was excellent. Dr. Sumergen arranged a last minute tour for us that included bus and plane transportation, hotel room, transfers and English speaking tour guides. Every detail was attended to and went off with a hitch. I highly recommend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: imuris
Reviews.Content: My wife and me just returned from a 1 week vacation to Turkey and we have to say that the ADA Hotel was a wonderful experience. We cant say enough good things about their great service, free internet and international phone calls-all the time. The accomodations were great-clean rooms and free beverages. The hotel is walking distance to all the major attractions and metro. Most important, the staff made us feel at home. They always went out of their way to make reservations for us, provided great recomendations for restaurants, a turkish bath and traditional turkish dance show. We most definitely will return when we return to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robonline
Reviews.Content: This 5-day break was my wife's birthday present to me. I selected the hotel from its reviews on here and elsewhere and, despite initial impressions of its location, it met or exceeded all our expectations: Welcoming hosts, immaculate rooms and facilities, good buffet breakfast etc, all as described by the hotel and in reviews. We made good use of the tea/coffee facilities, the breakfast balcony and even the room's jacuzzi. The weather was not kind and it was soooo good to come back to a warm, clean and comfortable room each day, stretch out and watch the news on TV or catch up on our emails. Its location is just a few minute walk from all the shops, cafes and historic sites you could want. If we ever return to Istanbul we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Kartina_17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ada hotel in middle of February, 2011. First of all, want to say that our airplane was late for 1 hour and driver from hotel was politely waiting for us at the arrival gate. Double room with jacuzzi was same size as we saw in video clip on website of the hotel. Panoramic view was really amazing, especially during sunset. Every day room was cleaned, furnishing for bed was changed. Breakfast was rich, tasty and had even pancakes, which are not popular abroad of Russia. That was extremely pleasant! Dr. Dogan Sumengen and his wife are very polite and hospital couple. Dr. helped us to find all sightseeings and exchanged some euro to turkish lira in compliance with current course. So there was no need to go to bank. All places of interest and tram line to Taksim is are situated 5-7 minutes from the hotel and you can easily find them. We would definitely recommend Ada Hotel to all people, who wish to visit Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable jewel”
Reviews.Author: ashland862
Reviews.Content: Returned after 2 years to an expanded and comfortable Ada Hotel. The breakfast terrace has been expanded both inside and outside with a beautiful view - see drawing. The room are quiet and with all the needs of a traveler. Use Dr. Dogan's travel service for trip to Cappodicia and Ephesus.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with a beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: alleana
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect in this lovely family-run hotel: the room, which had a beautiful view over the Marmara Sea, the breakfast table, where guests could find a large choice of sweet and savoury delicacies, and the service, which was friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: paul294452
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the ADA Hotel room 201, in the centre of the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, two minutes from The Hippodrome, We stayed there for three nights after reading positive reviews in Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. After a day long drive from Bulgaria we were warmly received by our hosts- Dogan and Hayva Just like the warmth you receive from your Mother when you return home for a visit. The room was everything that we expected and more. The pictures on Trip Advisor don't lie, Spacious with a large bed,so comfortable that after a day walking around the city you wanted to do nothing more than to plant yourself there for the night. We were also happy to find coffee/tea making facilities provided for that pick me up--free of charge.Silly though it may sound but it was a pleasure to find a spacious wardrobe in the room. The bathroom was clean and modern with a bath -jacuzzi for your relaxation note that towels are changed daily . As for the view this was a room with a view. a sea-view at that. You have a clear view of the Marmaris from the luxury of your room. We were overlooking a mosque, the early morning wake-up call was not any inconvenience you don't notice anything after the second morning, after-all you are in Istanbul. The breakfast will not fail to disappoint,there was a wide range of choice from a good old fried selection to the more healthy options.You will be able to enjoy the view from the terrace when the weather improves.The staff will gladly help with any queries if you are uncertain as to what to eat.I don't think this will be a problem as you stock up for your adventure in Istanbul, don't forget to take one of the many ferries to the Asian side where you will be very reluctant to leave.At the time of writing you will pay 1.75 Turkish Lyra for all modes of public transport in Istanbul simply buy your token at the tram stop/ ferryboat terminal from the dispenser. It is not based on number of stops. Back to the ADA as we came by car we were happy to find free on street parking outside the hotel, let them know that you are travelling by car so that the hotel can keep you a place. All in all the ADA was a wonderful oasis in the heart of this non stop city .it is a place we will be happy to go back to and a hotel I would happily recommend to anyone planning on visiting Istanbul. It is truly a home from home. Thanks Dogan and Hayva we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Its about location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Sindhu17
Reviews.Content: The Ada is so conveniently located that getting to any of the tourist sites of the sultanahmet area is just an easy walk. Dr Sumengen, the owner makes your stay absolutely pleasant and is willing to help with anything at all. The service is great because he sees to everything personally. The rooms have very comfortable matresses, clean and crisp linen ensuring a good nights sleep. The room and toilets are also very clean. The room size was a bit small and so is the hotel. Breakfast is wholesome and good but a variation on a few days would be welcome. Ada is a bit expensive on a comparison to other hotels but it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and location.”
Reviews.Author: BAHTravelers
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor and were wowed by the excellent reviews. We have, in the past, booked other hotels on other trips because of claims of incredible service and location and been disappointed. Not this time. The room was exactly as pictured on the site, was clean, huge, and the bed was so comfortable we hated to leave it behind. The location was perfect--in a quiet side street but only 5 minutes from Sultanhamet Square. The wake up call each morning from the mosque across the street's call to prayer completed the perfect setting. Breakfast was delicious and hearty. We loved having dessert with breakfast every morning (Turkish delight and baklava were always on the table). I will say that the breakfast room was very crowded; no doubt because so many people have discovered that this hotel is a gem. But, without a doubt, Dogan, the proprietor, was the highlight of the stay. He was so helpful--making restaurant reservations, arranging transport to and from the airport, making an apointment for us at a Turkish bath, and making recommendations for where to go and what to see, I, unfortunately, had a conference call back to the United States while there, and he even let me make my call from his lobby telephone--90 minutes, no charge. We aren't sure if we'll be able to squeeze in another trip to Istanbul, but we loved every minute of our stay and would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Dazzling Moments”
Reviews.Author: Lebvoyager
Reviews.Content: Simply awesome!!! Everything was spectacular, I really can`t find any negative word to say. Very cozy and warm. Very quiet unlike most of hotels in Istanbul. Value worth every single penny. Really I advice ADA Hotel for anyone wants to fully enjoy Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Manuwa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, modern and centrally located in the Old Istanbul area, Sultanahmet. We are within walking distance to Hagia Sofya, Blue Mosque and tram stop. Dr Sumengen, the owner of the hotel upgraded our room to one with jacuzzi and full use of kitchen without charge! He also offered to take us in his car on the first day of our arrival to Hamdi Restaurant enjoying tasty kebab. The breakfast in the terrace of the hotel is simply awesome. In a fair weather, you can enjoy full view of sea of Marmara. I wish i was there during summer to fully enjoy open air dining on the amazing roof terrace layout. The room is quiet, I could not hear any prayer call in the morning (Maybe I was too tired?) All in all, we will definitely come back to Ada Hotel if we visit Istanbul, the amazing city again!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, location and value!”
Reviews.Author: bavariagirl
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel Ada, Istanbul and loved every minute. We walked to almost everything. The view of the sea from our junior suite was fantastic as was the view from the 5th floor breakfast room. Rooms were a good size, comfortable bed and a nice shower. Only complaint was they serve instant coffee for breakfast. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “MARVELLOUS”
Reviews.Author: uab0611
Reviews.Content: I make a booking with this hotel for 7 nights from 28 Jan 2011 to 4 Feb 2011 and got free airport transfer. The owner, Dr Dogan had everything arranged to pick us up as planned. It was great. Tourists attraction are just a walk away like the blue mosque & grand bazaar. The metro tram is also a convenient transportation to get you aound. Good eating places are just around the corner near the hotel. The best of all is that on the last day of our stay, Dr Dogan upgrade our room to a suite room which is so spacious and that we feel is so thoughtful of him. Thoroughly I enjoyed my stay in this hotel. They make us feel like home.

Reviews.Title: “better than any other”
Reviews.Author: Alexandru127
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere was excellent, staff amaizing, room cozy and beautifully decorated. Boats on Marmara sea makes the view one of the best I've ever had. Nice old buildings, narrow paved streets , call to prayer take you from the real world and leave you in a story :-). All these through the room window.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Celine59
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel. Well located, near Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. Very nice staff. Quiet surroundings. Huge breakfast. Just be aware that the rooms are smaller than what you can see on their website.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: JVDLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room, and were given a double with a smaller (dressing?) room which had a single bed in it. My son (12) loved this as it gave him some privacy. Neither of the rooms were spacious, however they were well-equipped and spotless. The bed was very comfortable with a super-comfy duvet. The breakfasts were varied, and the view from the rooftop was great - though Istanbul is a city of great views. Free WiFi was useful, to be able to check the weather and local exhibitions from the comfort of our room. The hotel has a friendly, family-run feel, and the owners can provide as much or as little information as you require. There are neighbourhood cafes and restaurants just around the corner, and the major sights and the tram stops are within a 10 minute walk. I'd recommend this to pretty much anyone as a good base for exploring Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice to visit the main historical sites if Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mac_elina
Reviews.Content: I have been there for 2 nights 3 days for a quick Week end in Istanbul with my sister and my mother. First great thing : they have room with 3 beds without paying an excessive additional fee. What could I say : the breakfast is great, you really can eat for the day if you want and the location on the terrasse is wonderful to eat in the morning. The hotel is 10 minutes walk from most things you can see in a week end : Topkapi, Blue Mosquee, Grand Bazaar, and Sainte Sophie and 5 minutes from tramway station. For people who wants to experiment the night life, definitely this is not the right place to stay. But if you want a relaxing stay to wake up early to start visits, then it is the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Istanbul and Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Junaid83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Ada Hotel for four nights and absolutely loved the little hotel run very professionally by Dr. Dogan and his wife. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel that our room had been upgraded (for the same price) due to the non-arrival of a full group of guests. The room was very clean and had a very nice view of the Marmara Sea - the jacuzzi in the room was a bonus. Our room was very spacious with ample closet space and plenty of room to move around - it was also very bright as it had a big window facing the sea and the sun was shining for most of our stay. The bathroom was spacious and very clean. Breakfast at the hotel rooftop was scrumptious and it was made even better due to fabulous views of the sea and mosque - the crepes and cheeses are highly recommended. Dr. Dogan and his wife were very helpful when we were planning our day trips in the city and had great recommendations and offered useful advice/local tips. All in all, we had a great first experience of Istanbul and would definitely stay at Ada next time we visit and probably have our parents/family come with us too. Oh and Dr. Dogan and his wife gave us really cute gifts when we were departing the hotel - they were great !

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: Selma99
Reviews.Content: My daughter, granddaughter and I stayed at the end of our travels in Turkey for 3 nights at the Ada Horel Istanbul. We enjoyed our stay there very much. The rooms are very well appointed, including an adapter for my computer, jacuzzi bath tubs, very modern all around. We were warmly welcomed by the proprietors and even found a free phone connection to USA. Breakfast on the upper terrasse with view down to the waterfront and ships passing by, was prepared and constantly freshened up by two lovely young ladies. They offered all the typical dishes, and also freshly prepared crepes as well as other unique hot dishes. The hotel is located in easy walking distance to all major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent service and great ambience.”
Reviews.Author: denisereiss
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with excellent service and great ambience. Super location near Hippodrome & Blue Mosque in Sultanahmet, near tram. Nice breakfast w/ view of Sea of Marmara. Very kind personnel who took good care of us and provided every convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, homely & convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Shaikhah23
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and we had a wonderful time staying at Ada Hotel for the 8 days we were there. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the daily breakfast buffet spread was homecooked and delicious, we especially loved the crepes. Not enough can be said about the location of the hotel, it is less than 5 minutes from the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque and less than 10 minutes from the Hagia Sophia. There is a tram station in the heart of Sultanahmet which is walking distance from the hotel so it is convenient if you need to travel to other parts of Istanbul. What made the stay even more pleasant was the hospitality of the owners, Dr Dogan and his wife. They made sure that all our queries were answered and they regularly asked how we were doing and whether we were enjoying our stay. Overall, it is a wonderful hotel, and it is highly recommended. We would not hesitate to return to Ada Hotel should we ever visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Ada Hotel - Consistently best in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: VICHADA
Reviews.Content: Ada Hotel is consistently best in Istanbul for a reason. On my second stay at Ada Hotel, I stayed for 8 days and it was indeed even lovelier the second time around! - gracious Turkish hospitality and first rate service from Dr. and Mrs. Dogan Sumengen and staff; very clean and well cared rooms and magnificent views; safe and secure location; convenient location for shopping, touring, feasting or simply sipping coffee late at night; local tram only a few meters away, affording travelers the opportunity to see different districts/villages of Istanbul; free wi-fi and phone calls to the US and Canada and of course the sumptuous breakfast spread that never fails to start the day. I will definitely be back with my family as we have found our home away from home with our Turkish family. I will always cherish the conversations I had with Dr. and Mrs. Dogan Sumengen as I learned so much about Turkey and the things that really mattered in life. Thank you Dr and Mrs. Dogan!

Reviews.Title: “True Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Shammasi-couple
Reviews.Content: Although we had not planned this trip in advance, everything turned out perfect! We were overwhelmed by the Turkish hospitality at Ada. We felt right at home! Dr.Dogan (owner) and his lovely wife went extra lengths to keep us happy and satisfied. Breakfast at the terrace was the best! The view was breathtaking! Sea side rooms were better and although the standard rooms and bathrooms are a bit small and there is no color coordination in the decor, the place was comfortable enough. Water pressure in the bathrooms is excellent! The location is excellent and literally a walking distance from all the important historic sites. Security is good with safe boxes in the room. Perfect value for money!

Reviews.Title: “A very special place,highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: burrard
Reviews.Content: We booked the Ada following strong recommendations from friends who had stayed at the hotel over the past two years. The Ada exceeded our expectations, it is a gem. It is located close to the major sites, rooms are clean, well furnished and the breakfasts first class. The view and the jacuzzi made it a wonderful place to reenergize after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view”
Reviews.Author: Malamea
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on great reviews on this site. And the Ada is an OK hotel. Nothing fancy, the room slightly on the small side, but the view from the room and roof terrace is stunning. And the place is very clean. We found a guidebook on Istanbul in the hotelÂ´s bookshelf, and were encouraged to keep it for our stay. A very kind gesture! The room is well equipped with water, coffee making facilities and fridge. And the bottled water is reasonably priced. We were woken up every morning at 6 am to the prayer call from the minaret - so no need for a wake up call! :-) The location is very quiet during nighttime so you get a good nightÂ´s sleep. The hotel is very close to a lot of the "must sees" and thus a great location for seeing Istanbul. The neighborhood itself does not have a lot of restaurants or places to eat, but this is not a problem. The hotel will recommend restaurants for you - we went with their recommendations for a fish restaurant one night. The fish restaurant was ok - nothing outstanding. But we eat a lot of fish and are probably quite difficult to please. So my recommendation would be to be very explicit in your requirements and budgets when getting the hotel to recommend a place. When we were checking out, we were asked if we could pay in cash. (We did the check out the evening around 23.00 prior to our departure since we were leaving very early in the morning.) We were offered a free transfer to the airport if we settled the account in cash. I donÂ´t find that appropriate. If the hotel prefers cash payment they should have stated so in advance and not expect us to wander out at night to find an ATM and walk around with huge amounts of cash... Also, withdrawing cash on our credit card abroad is quite costly (more than the free transport...) When we declined the offer, we were able to pay using our credit card. But this should not have been an issue at all. The hotel staff were attentive and smiling. The breakfast was good - a wide selection of hot and cold dishes, coffee, tea and juice, and fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Went back twice”
Reviews.Author: willnino
Reviews.Content: Our trip around Turkey meant we started and finished in Istanbul. On our arrival we landed at the Ada Hotel and were able to scope it out for the finish of our trip, where we would have a party of 8. This little hotel is in a great location and has a very scenic rooftop breakfast area. This was our first exposure to Istanbul and what better way to see the Marmaris Sea side of the old city from our rooftop location. It is easy walking to all the main locations and we found it quite easy to find our way around and back to the hotel. We did have a basic room on our first visit but got room 303 on our return, which was bigger and had nicer views. It is close to the mini Sophia, which means that the call to prayer is quite loud...:-) I had never heard it before but became quite used to it. Of the 5 calls, the only one that really affects you is the 6am blast but it happens all over the city, so hard to avoid. Would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, conveniently situated”
Reviews.Author: jainBGodalmingUK
Reviews.Content: Nice unpretentious hotel, the owners were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast's up on the roof terrace very good. It's worth walking down towards the waterfront, lovely pastel coloured houses and quiet art shops, all without the mad hustle of the main tourist areas. Special mention to the lovely Georgian lasses that work at the hotel, they are delightful, I stood upon a table up on the roof terrace with them to watched a turkish wedding party dance and sing in the carpark next to the hotel - magical. There are two small supermarkets just around the corner from the hotel - one sells alcohol, one not. watch the paths, they are lethal, we had to help an American lady who went flying down a pothole - keep your wits about you!.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: zosia_74
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to spend weekends with your spouse or partner, especially the room with jacuzzi and see veiw. Very polite and friendly personnel, convenient location (3 minutes to Blue Mosque and saint Sofia and other historical places)

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem”
Reviews.Author: jsp1000
Reviews.Content: A Small Family run business in the Heart of Istanbul,rooms are spotless and beds are very comfortable. It's a few minutes stroll to the Tourist attractions of Sultanahmet so the location is hard to beat. A buffet style breakfast is served at the top of the Hotel with great Views across the City which is a lovely way to start the day. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Istanbul !!

Reviews.Title: “I was very impressed. This hotel is unique and beautifully appointed.”
Reviews.Author: oddly257
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my family, five in total. The hotel is unique in that the rooms are adjoining so that any number of people can travel together . If travelling with children the rooms can be side by side with adjoining doors. There are also rooms with suite so that 2 rooms can be off the living room. Neat! Dogan,the owner is also a well-known and very knowlegeable travel agent. He was very patient. We went armed with our copy of the Lonely Planet and we got him to arrange our tour to Cappodocia as well as Pamukkale at a very reasonable price. The hotel price includes breakfast which is sumptuous and sportsa terrace overlooking a historic mosque as well as a brilliant view of the Marmara Sea. We would definitely stay here again. Bravo Dugan! We are airline employees so we will recommend the hotel to our friends. Audrey, Ann, Rachael and Michele your friends in Canada

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Ultrarun
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good about this place: Modern, clean, friendly, extremely nice room, flatscreen TV w/foreign coverage. Free phone calls o USA, amazing assortment of foods for included breakfast, including my favorite potato salad, free FAST wifi with good coverage. Only steps away from hippodrome and blue mosque. Quiet residential area. What more could one want?! I'm just hoping it won't be all booked up next time I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience for first time in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: DarrellFreund
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent nine days at the Ada Hotel in a deluxe suite with a jacuzzi. My wife was six months pregnant when we stayed at the Ada. Dr. Dogon and his wife were very gracious and accommodating people. They arranged tours and airport transfers. We enjoyed the wonderful breakfasts and views of the Marmara Sea from the hotel rooftop terrace, and were grateful for the hotel's central location. I do not think our trip to Istanbul would have been as memorable if we had stayed at another hotel. Staying at a hotel that is managed by the owners really makes a difference. I would not hesitate to stay at the Ada again, and I strongly suggest staying at the Ada when traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER”
Reviews.Author: jaskaSlovenia
Reviews.Content: ADA HOTEL is very clean hotel, near to all atractions, people who works there are very nice and always there to help you..

Reviews.Title: “Great location very hospitable owners quaity accommodation at good price”
Reviews.Author: JohnH20
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a full week and found Dr Sumengen and his wife to be very hospitable hosts, There was a complimentary pick up from the airport because of the length of stay.The hotel has a family feel and nothing seemed too much trouble.. The room was decorated to a high standard ( we were staying in a triple that was complete with TV and jacuzzi bath) good size comfortable beds and efficient air conditioning that made for a comforable nights sleep. A really wide choice of food at breakfast enjoyed on the roof overlooking the marmara sea set us up well for the day, 4 mins walk to Hiipodrome and Blue mosque. Very suited to families. If we return to Istanbul at some stage we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant, warm, clean, excellent hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: lillyDSM
Reviews.Content: What more can i say about the Ada hotel? After reading the good reviews from other travelers , we decided to stay there during our recent vacation to Istanbul. All that has been written is so true!The hotel is located very close, within walking distance to the main sites in Sultanahmet. We were given a suite facing the sea of Marmara. The view was perfect! Rooms very large, clean, tastefully decorated. bathrooms were equipped with modern fittings, and jacuzzi in all rooms!The owner, Dr Gohan and his beautiful wife, Eva made us feel like we were home. Breakfast in the morning was delicious.! From the rooftop, the view of Marmara sea was great , while having breakfast. Dr Gohan helped us arrange our tour, and gave us some great shopping tips. Thank you Dr!. There is a laptop that guests can use, with free internet. And also one can make free phone calls to USA and Canada, which i think was fantastic!There is really nothing to complain about this hotel. We will definitely want to stay at the Ada hotel again if we plan to visit Istanbul. Ummi Adamjee

Reviews.Title: “Small family run hotel close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: GummyShark
Reviews.Content: This is a great little boutique hotel in a quiet area of the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul, yet it is only a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, etc etc and the tram line. The rooms are great, most with very good views over the Sea of Mamaris. The breakfasts are fantastic and sitting up on the terrace makes it even better. Staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are comfortable and furnished to a high standard. Istanbul is an amazing place and I would stay here again without a moments hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay at Ada Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MonaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in late June. Everything about this hotel was perfect for us!! Upon arrival we were upgraded to a room with gorgeous view and a jacuzzi (if we go back i would definitely pay the extra for the nicer room). The rooms are super clean, spacious and bright. The hotel is in a great location- within easy walking distance to most of the historical sights, the grand bazar, the spice market and plenty of restaurants. Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace each morning and I have to say it was one of my favourite things about this hotel. Gorgeous view accompanied by delicious food! Finally, I must mention the hotel staff. The husband and wife owners were just so good to us. Really warm and helpful and we couldnt have asked for better hospitality. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay! I would absolutely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: solomonandjessie
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here. Shared a triple room with 2 friends, very spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious with a really good selection. Staff and owners were so pleasant and helpful, lending us umbrellas when it was raining and phoning when we'd checked out of hotel to inform us that one of our party had left their mobile phone behind. This was my first time in Istanbul and a lot of hotels of this rating and in this area of Istanbul seem to have similar reviews, but I really can't imagine how any could be as good as the Ada. I will definitely stay here if I return to Istanbul (which I sincerely hope I do).

Reviews.Title: “Superb hospitality and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Babsnet
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying at the Ada Hotel and were delighted with everything - from the superb management to the delicious breakfast to the excellent location. Dr. Sumengen and everyone at the hotel went out of their way to ensure that we had a wonderful stay. Dr. Sumengen was extremely helpful in providing information and organizing various activities for us. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, pleasant service, rooftop breakfast with a view”
Reviews.Author: simmondsi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Ada hotel in a family room - this consists of a large double room (spacious with a jacuzzi) and a connecting regular double room, each with a bathroom. Ideal for us with our 11 and 14 year old boys. The standard double is quite small, so I'd recommend paying the extra if there are just 2 of you and you are not on a tight budget. Rooms are clean, very nicely maintained with compact but elegant and modern bathrooms. They contain a small fridge / minibar - the drinks are the same price as outside the hotel, so that means cheap; a nice touch. Breakfast was a delight, taken on the rooftop terrace overlooking the Marmara Sea and part of the old town. Location is superb, just 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and from there you can walk to all the main sights (Topkapi etc), yet in a relatively quiet street. Service is good, and also discreet and not overbearing. Dr Dogan is happy to offer advice, also arrange airport transfers etc. There was a laptop in the lobby with internet access for guests, free of charge. One thing you need to be aware of: There is a nearby mosque and the muezzin call is loud. The first one is 4.45am (the last one at 10pm) so be prepared to be woken up by this, even if you are a heavy sleeper. Thanks to other TA reviewers we were ready for this, and also found it all part of the great experience of being in Istanbul. We were able to get back to sleep anyhow. For the last two nights I used the ear plugs I brought along and it was fine. To be honest this must be the same for any hotel in any decent location in Istanbul - and believe me, it's way better being right in the heart of things than out near the airport or something. If (when) we return to Istanbul, we will be coming back to the Ada Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations, boutique, elegant”
Reviews.Author: webdiva3
Reviews.Content: Luxurious boutique hotel, so close to the Blue Mosque and major sites, yet on a quiet little street. We splurged for the full view of the Marmara Sea and it was worth every Turkish Lira. Thick white towels, spacious room, comfortable bed with gorgeous linens. Dr. S encouraged us to visit sites that he felt we would appreciate and he was right. He steered us to good restaurants and helped us navigate local transportation, including the ferry up the Bosphorous. His wife welcomed us every morning, along with her staff for a bountiful breakfast: French pressed coffee, Turkish teas, elegant egg, potato & cheese dishes with lots of fresh fruit; all overlooking the sea. The calls to prayer at the mosques in front of the hotel were beautiful and magical.. the seagulls flew around the night-lit minarets. We highly recommend this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Full marks for location, a little less once youre in it.”
Reviews.Author: mnaaz
Reviews.Content: I went to Turkey for my honeymoon and stayed at Ada, not too expensive but not cheap trash either, its averagely priced for a big city. It took a little remembering to get to it since its in one of the narrow winding but quaint and quiet lanes of the Sultanahmet area. But about a 5 minute walk out of the quiet area, youre in the middle of it all - Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Grand Bazaar, tramway to everywhere else. Its all there just a short cobblestoned walk away. So full marks for that. The owner is a sweet man and his wife is wonderful and friendly. We got all our sightseeing info and bookings through them effortlessly. Also, the turkish breakfast every morning was tasty, healthy and we saw variety in the main dishes. Of course the staples were there every morning. They upgraded us to a 3rd floor room with a better view and a jacuzzi since we were honeymooners, but just for 2 nights. What dampened my experience eventually, after about 4 nights there was the size of the rooms. They're small and got to us. Cant blame him cos the buildings there are narrow. So if you're staying longer and dont like small spaces, think twice before coming here. Otherwise, i'd go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Best attention IÂ´ve ever had in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: tatoweb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this small, family-runned hotel with my mother and girlfriend from may 27 to june 6 and the owner really cared about us in every minute of our stay. Dr. Dogan will help you with EVERYTHING you may need with dedication, currency exchange, places to go, shuttle to any place, maps, directions, recommendations, etc, etc. We left at 3:00 oÂ´clock in the morning and he was awake just to say bye to us!!!. The rooms are extremly clean, location is excellent for first time visitors, breakfast is excellent, free wi-fi signal is excellent and if you donÂ´t have a computer, thereÂ´s a public laptop in the lobby you can use anytime. In conclusion IÂ´ll recommend it to anybody!.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: maudegonne
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a week in the Ada hotel in May and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.We would agree entirely with all of the earlier great reviews. In particular, we loved the central location which made it very convenient to come to in the afternoons for a break from sightseeing and convenient for sightseeing and restaurants. We found Mr. Sumengan and his family to be extremely helpful and kind, rather like a host rather than a hotel proprietor.In particular when we thought that we had a problem with our flights home on the last night we were there, Mr. Sumengan could not have been of more assistance and sorted the confusion out for us.Also the breakfasts are wonderful with great choice fo fresh fruits and delicious yoghurt and honey. Everywhere was spotless and our room, the de luxe suite was a real treat to stay in.All in all this hotel was a very friendly haven in the middle of a very busy and noisy city, a home away from home and we loved every minute of it. We would love to go back there and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Small, well-run, gracious hosts.”
Reviews.Author: dm59Chicago
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Istanbul with our children and stayed at the Hotel Ada for ten days. The hotel is within walking distance to the Blue Mosque and the Haggia Sophia. Breakfast on the upper floor had a lovely view of the water, and the variety of foods was enough to satisfy our picky younger child. During our stay, our son became quite ill and the hosts could not have been more gracious and accommodating during this time. This is not a full-service hotel, but simple requests were met and handled efficiently. Fussy and demanding Americans should stay away, but if you are mostly self-sufficient, you will do well here. If traveling with a family, ask for the two rooms with an adjoining foyer on the first floor. Be aware, however, that you will be on street level and can hear the foot and automobile traffic during the day. There is little to no night life in this area of town, so during the night the noise is virtually nonexistent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Great Innkeeper”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuyLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in a larger room w/ pull-out couch and plenty of space. Bright, clean and quiet, amazing views and remodeled everything. Elevator to haul heavy bags upstairs. Excellent location for tourism. 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, 15 to Hagia Sofia and tram line, 20 to Topkopi Palace and the covered Bazaar. There is a small market one short block away for snacks, wine, sodas, beer, but the stuff in the mini bar is priced very fair. Also, a good chicken / rice / pita place across from the market for a quick bite at crazy low prices. Breakfast (included) is great with fresh fruit, bread, tea and coffee on the outside terrace overlooking the sea - a great way to start the day. The innkeeper is very friendly, speaks English very well, and will arrange tours, etc. Just ask. Extra - Free pick-up from the airport. Really appreciated when you first arrive. Cab to airport is 60 lira or 30 euro or 40 US$. Free wireless. Think about - Right across the street from a mosque that begins call to prayer at what seems like 4.30am; wife liked it, me not so much. Downside - At 179 euro / night a bit spendy. But since they were completely booked most of the week we were there, it's clearly not "over priced." The basic rooms are "European cramped," but only 109 euro (we moved after one night to the larger room.) Tip: Many places take euro at about 2:1, but smaller places take only Turkish lira.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: CalgarySunseekr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here before our cruise and were glad to find out the previous positive reviews were all accurate. Dr. Doggan Sumengen and Eva are gracious hosts and very helpful. The room was clean and very comfortable. Breakfasts were amazing and with a great view of the sea of Marmara. We walked to everything and could not have been more pleased with this stay. We definitely recommend the Ada.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DaveECambridge
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located within a few minutes walk of the key attractions such as blue mosque and Topkapi palace. The owners could not be more friendly and helpful and we were made to feel very much at home . The rooms were comfortable and the breakfast excellent with a wide ranging buffet.This was situated in a small but clean breakfast room with fantastic views over the sea as well as a roof terrace.There are plenty of restaurants nearby although there are basic cooking facilities in the room.If we return to Istanbul we would definitely return to the Ada Hotel. Dave and Shirley,Cambridge,England

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sibilam
Reviews.Content: Dr. Sumengen and his wife Eva are the two individuals who set this place apart. Their personable approach and professionalism were key to make our stay in this extraordinary city such a pleasure. The immaculate condition of the rooms, the delicious and fresh breakfasts, their restaurant recommendations around the city and transportation arrangements were perfect and contributed to one of the most enjoyable stays we've ever had in any European city. We would definitely stay here again and we highly recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a "home away from home" in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: gladgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ada Hotel for 9 nights. We had a large room with a king size bed and beautiful view of the Marmara Sea.The room was immaculate and in addition to a modern bathroom there was a jacuzzi tub to relax and enjoy after walking all day.Our hosts Dr. Dogan Sumengen and his wife Eva were kind and helpful fulfilling any request. Breakfasts were a sumptous affair with both Turkish and Continental offerings,more than we could eat. In addition to all of this the location was perfect. A lovely small hotel. Dr. and Mrs Van Johnson Warren, Pa.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious hospitality, comfortable surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Milomiller
Reviews.Content: Dr. Dogan Sumengen is the gracious host of the family-run Ada Hotel Istabul. During our recent trip to Turkey, we stayed at the Ada Hotel twice for a total of seven nights. Dr. Sumengen was always available to help us with our requests, whether calling a reliable cab, making arrangements for transportation to the airport, answering our questions about the impact of the volcanic eruption on Turkish flights, or providing directions to sights in the area. We enjoyed an exceptionally clean, comfortable, and spacious room. The complimentary breakfast offered by the hotel is excellent with a variety of dishes. The hotel has the amenities you would expect, such as Wi-Fi and flat screen TVs, but it also offers an unexpected amenity--free telephone service to the United States which came in very handy when our ATM card did not initially work. The hotel is located only a few blocks from the Hippodrome and the Blue Mosque and is across the street from a beautiful 16th century mosque designed by Sinan. Its location is its one disadvantage--the morning call to prayer can easily be heard! Regardless, this hotel has our highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PBDee
Reviews.Content: An excellent small hotel. Very close to the main sights in the best part of Istanbul. Beautiful views from rooms. Well equipped and maintained rooms with unlimited tea making facilities and a good buffet breakfast. What really sets it apart is the friendly and courteous personal attention from the proprietors. If we return to Istanbul we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family run hotel.”
Reviews.Author: angelo65Geneva
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights at the Ada Hotel with my wife and three children.Everything written in the previous reviews is correct.Quiet location,except early morning mosque.Very clean and modern rooms.Good breakfast.Great terrace views on the Marmara sea.Free internet etc etc... The owners are lovely people who take great pride in helping you have a memorable stay in Istanbul.Definitely a sure bet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Jonmeg
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at Hotel Ada, we were informed by the lovely man at reception that we would receive an upgrade to a suite. This was just the beginnings of a perfect stay. The suite was beautiful; with classy furniture and decor, a jacuzzi tub and a wonderful view of a nearby mosque, the blue mosque and the Bosphorus. We had the best sleep we had had in a long time on the very comfortable bed. Breakfast the next morning was amazing, set up on the fifth floor with a lovely outdoor section with the same beautiful view. There was a huge selection, with everything we could want and more. This hotel checked all the boxes and then some. Our only disappointment was that we couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal we found in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at three different hotels in Istanbul in March. We felt Ada Hotel gave the best value, confirming TripAdvisor rankings. We stayed in room 201 (Euro 89 per night on cash basis), a sea view room. Staying for three nights qualified us for free airport pickup. A driver was waiting at the airport with a sign with our name on it, and we were checked in and shown to our room at about 9:30 a.m. which was most welcome after a 13-hour flight. Location Excellent for main tourist attractions and near both the Divanyolu Street (Amedros Cafe, Faros Hotel Resto, Pasha Cafe, Adonin, Khorasane, Istanbul Enjoyer) and Akbiyik Street (Turquoise, Rumist, En La Luna, Kathisma Cafe) high-ranking TripAdvisor member restaurants. Walking distance to post office, tram stops, Hippodrome, Ayasofya, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Cistern. Closest tram stop is Sultanahmet. Quiet enjoyment Quiet street. Sometimes vehicles labor up the hill or from the second floor we could hear voices of people walking on the street below. The higher the room, less the noise. Can hear neighbor noise only when in the bathroom (had a family with baby next door). We would call this a quiet hotel. Internet access A laptop computer was available free in lobby, but we didn't need to use it. We were able to use wi-fi with our Linux computer in the room during all three days. The speed was medium fast. The Windows computer wouldn't connect. Wi-fi in the room was the best of the three hotels (in the other two it was non-existent). View The view from the second floor room included about 25 degrees of the Sea of Marmara split by an abandoned minaret of a mosque (see photo). Views are better on higher floors. Room comfort Heat was available in radiators whenever we wanted to turn them on. Elevator went to all floors including rooftop. Room was neat with clean carpet on floor (see photo), everything worked well. The room had electrical sockets at many convenient places including both sides of the bed. We never used the jacuzzi in the room, and we never used the free phone in the lobby that calls direct to the US and Canada. The refrigerator was cold, and Ada Hotel sold water and drinks at the same price as in the supermarket. There were facilities for making coffee and tea. After we used the first bottle of water, we had to buy water at the Dia supermarket. Maid didn't add soap during the 3 days we were there. Dr. Dogan explained the procedure for turning on the cable TV. There were news channels in English. The room key was the most sophisticated of any of the keys we saw in Istanbul. Hospitality Dr. Dogan's attentiveness must be a key portion of the hotel's popularity. He and his wife stay in a room adjoining the lobby, so he appears to be available 24 hours a day, like a concerned parent. He is eager to help in any way, and his recommendations for restaurants (Grup Saray and Sultanahmet Koftecesi) and his directions were very good. He gave us a map of Istanbul (from Cemberlitas Turkish Bath) that was better than any other we had found. He drew maps and made sure we understood his directions. He explained how to use the tram and how to buy an akbil, or device that you can load with Turkish Lira credits for transportation. He made reservations for us to eat dinner in the Maiden's Tower and gave us clear transportation directions for reaching it. We got around quite easily after learning from him. We asked to buy one postcard from the collection on his wall, and he just gave it to us free. Breakfast On rooftop. Good view of Sea of Marmara. Delicacies offered every morning including more expensive items such as dried figs and baklava, halvi, hard boiled eggs, juice from cartons, fresh fruit, cereal, bread and cakes. One of the better breakfasts we encountered. Of the three hotels that we visited in March, this is the one we would return to because of location, Dr. Dogan's safety-net helpfulness, the clean rooms, and the fact that everything (including in-room wi-fi) worked and nothing appeared to linger without repair.

Reviews.Title: “will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: black_condor
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ada Hotel 4 nights in March of this year with a friend. We lived in the suite on the second floor (room 303) which was very clean, spacious, with a nice bed and an amazing view of the old city and the Bosphorus. Overall, the hotel's service was top-notch. The owner (an older gentlemen) was very helpful and flexible. The staff were also very friendly and quick. Breakfast left me wishing I could stay more - it was that good! A special mention should be given to the location - it is a walking distance from virtually everything you would want to see in the old city on your first couple of trips. A tram stop is a 5 minute walk away in case you want to go to Taksim and Pera. We did just that: went to Taksim by tram and walked all the way back to the hotel. We also arranged with the hotel for a taxi transfer from/to the airport. It cost 20EU one way. Very convenient. To sum up, a great experience worth repeating.

Reviews.Title: “After 7 visits to Istanbul found a hotel I would return to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Xan432
Reviews.Content: This is the best kept secret in Istanbul! The Ada Hotel has everything one would want and expect - location, amiable hosts, wonderful rooms, great breakfast, modern conveniences, free wi-fi, computer and even a free Skype phone to call the US and Canada! The owners are a lovely couple who have completely restored a house with large spacious rooms, brand new, IMMACULATE bathrooms, elevator, and flat screen tvs in every room! The location of the hotel is perfect. Located only 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque, it is tucked on a side street. There is no noise, the tourists and their buses are down the road! Across the street is a 1000 year old brick column set among some ruins. It is not a tourist attraction, so there is no traffic and no cars! Our reservations requested a room with twin beds. The owner recognized his error when we arrived and since he did not have a twin room available, he gave us 2 rooms for the same price! I travel often and have never had such a welcoming, accommodating host! The price is unbeatable - 49 Euros for a double! The beds were wonderful. The owners were hospitable. The breakfast buffet was scrumptious. There is not one thing that I would change nor could any improvements be suggested! Having visited Istanbul 6 previous times, I can finally say I found a place that I look forward to returning! If you have the opportunity, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service”
Reviews.Author: CaroNL
Reviews.Content: We had a really good experience at the Ada Hotel. The other reviews gave a good impression of the hotel. I was even prepared for the morning prayer sounds ;-) The view was beautiful, location really good. What we liked best is the friendly atmosphere of this family-run hotel. The breakfast at the rooftop was great and we were welcomed in such a friendly way, with explanations of the food (of the Turkish food, but there is a lot of choice of European food too) . The day we left we had to get a taxi at 7:00 AM. The manager made sure the taxi arrived in time (he called twice when the taxi was 5 minutes late) but he also personally made sure our breakfast was ready at 6:30AM. Really good service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hospitality Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: FussyTraveler67
Reviews.Content: Perfect Hotel!! Dr. Dugan is the best host I have ever met!!! He speaks great English and takes the time to show you how everything works in the room. He even was up when we arrived at 12:30 a.m. to show us everythng and got up at 3:15 a.m. to see us off when we left - now that is dedication!!! My husband and I traveled with ourtwo 20-something year old children and I requested 2 rooms close together on 2nd floor and he gave us rooms right next to each other on 2nd floor and even upgraded one room to accommodate our wishes. The whirlpool in the room is a perfect touch and very relaxing. The rooms I booked - the cheapest ones - are not large (but good size for European hotel rooms) but have everything you need and even a whirlpool tub and room to set out suitcases. There is also a minibar with great prices on bottled water and a safe and color TV with some English channels. There is great wifi free in the whole hotel and a free laptop to use in the lobby! The shower is nice and strong with plenty of hot water. Everything was very clean and the breakfast was very tasty. My only suggestion for improvement would be hotplates or warmers for some of the items at breakfast. They had wonderful homemade items and some would have tasted better warm (maybe they do this in the summer when they are busier because January is a slow time in Istanbul). Since I like egg-type dishes warm, after a couple of days I made toast and had the boiled eggs and they were very good. They have a wide variety of items - fruit, yogurt, baklava, egg dishes, breads, boiled eggs, juices, milk, etc. The location is perfect for a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkaki Palace, Grand Bazaar and the waterfront. Dr. Dogan will give you directions everywhere. If you want to go out on the water - do it yourself. He offers you tours but if you ask, he will tell you how to take the ferry with the locals and it is super cheap and runs frequently - it's a great way to get out on the water and from one land mass to the other. The metro is also cheap if you go far but everything in Sultanahment is within walking distance. He also directed us to a great local restaurant with good food at a reasonable cost - he even called to see if they were open since it was January and some places were not. January is a great time to visit because hotels are cheaper and Istanbul doesn't get extremely cold. It's not warm but very decent. And bargain in the Grand Bazaar - in January they are willing to make very good deals because there are not very many tourists - the ceramics are my favorite thing to buy in the world and they have great shopping!! We booked 2 rooms each night for 4 nights. If you book on their website for more than 3 nights you get a free private transfer from the airport to the hotel (at least we did in January) and it worked perfectly with the driver waiting for us with a sign with my name on it. For the price I paid that included a wonderul breakfast and free wifi, tv, safe, minibar, whirlpool and perfect location this place cannot be beat. Dr. Dugan sent us off at 3:15 a.m. with free bottles of water to the airport. Do not pass up his amazing hospitality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: WeeYY
Reviews.Content: Dr Dogan was exceptional in his level of service and care to the guests. He took the trouble to introduce all the sights and attractions near the hotel and recommended those that were worth going. This was really appreciated as we were there for only 2 days. We were upgraded to a very spacious suite. The room was clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated. The hotel is within walking distance to all the major sites and the breakfast spread was wider and of better quality than some of those in chain hotels. We enjoyed our trip very much and would certainly return to this hotel if we ever visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not great”
Reviews.Author: John_Moschos
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews for the Ada, I had high expectations, but in the end I left thinking it was just OK. We were met at the airport, even though our flight arrived late. Note that the hotel does not take you back to the airport on departure - they recommend a shuttle bus for 10 lira. As I has only an overnight bag I took the tram/metro to the airport, which took about an hour (probably quicker than the bus), and cost only 3 lira. Our room was spacious and clean and had a nice view, although the bath in the bedroom is a little bizarre. On the minus side, I didn't find the proprietor particularly helpful. After a little research we managed to find better restaurants than he could recommend. His recommendations on things to do seemed oriented to packaged tours, and he even recommended a carpet store (although he didn't push this). The windows in our room let in water when it rained, and room service never replaced the toilet paper (we had to ask). Breakfast was OK, but not great. The hot dishes seemed to be re-heated, limited fruit juice, and I didn't even see any yoghurt, although maybe I missed it, as you would think it a breakfast standard. The terrace was certainly a nice place to have breakfast. However if you have an early flight you are out of luck, as breakfast doesn't start until 8.30. It is also impossible to walk up to the 5th floor for breakfast - there were no stairs so the tiny lift is the only option. Getting out in a fire would be tricky too, as one stair well was littered with cleaning equipment, and the ground floor door was blocked by the proprietor's desk. However there is another unobstructed stair well running down from the 3rd floor. Two more positives: the free internet in the lobby was handy, and we were grateful for the umbrellas as it rained most days. Overall, the Ada was fine, but no better than many other places. I will look elsewhere next time I visit Istanbul, probably not in Sultanahmet, given the poor choice of mid-level restaurants there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the value”
Reviews.Author: jt7dreamz
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is amazing. Toast, yogurt, fruit (great selection) adn veggies, tea, coffee, olives, cheese, hard boiled eggs, croissants, baklava. Great selection, but yes a little light on protein per the Meditereanean diet. Rooms vary greatly in size. Also saw some bargaining going on which was interesting since we had booked directly at a very affordable price (or so we thought). There was a car ready to pick us up at the airprot because we booked direct and stayed 3+ nights which was just plain nice. The hotelier was very helpful, made lots of reservations and gave us good suggestions. he did try and recommend a plethora of places from which we assume he got a kickback, but who knows. Hotel is a stones throw from a mosque but I dont know of a person who manages to escape the 6 am wakeup call. And no, earplugs don't help. A/C wasnt the greatest but sufficed. Free water was a nice perk. Balcony off the kitchen is spectacular and offers great views. hotel is a 5 min stroll to the Blue Mosque etc, great area from which to branch out. ALSO, hotel has a magijack phone so calls abroad are free. We used it almost every night to call home etc. It's in the lobby but well worth it. Theres also a pc in the lobby for you to use. We waited 1x for like 20 min in the 5 days we were there. I would stay here again if you're on a budget- its well worth the $$.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely people”
Reviews.Author: clarenrussell
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. Our room looked out over a small mosque to the Sea of Marmara. We heard the mezzuin each morning, but to us that was part of the charm. The room, while small, was typical for the old city. If you want a huge room, maybe the Hilton would be more your style. For us, the ambience offered by the Ada was enjoyable. Rooms were clean and the shower was always hot and had lots of pressure. The bed was comfortable and so were the pillows. The breakfast, although the same each day, offered enough variety of dishes not to be boring - cereal, yoghurt, cold meats, salad, sweets, breads, juices, coffees and tea. And baklava! There was always plenty of it, too, even on those mornings we got off to a slow start. The cook was a real charmer and so friendly, despite having no English. She certainly loved people to enjoy her food. Each morning on our short walk to the tram, we passed the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. The proximity to these fabulous sights was not marred by heavy traffic noise, which I did hear other travellers staying in other hotels in the vicinity complain of. The best things about the hotel were the friendliness of the staff - even though we arrived at 5 in the morning - the quiet yet central location, and the food. The whole experience was excellent and we will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, small, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Arnanipa
Reviews.Content: Smal hotel with a good location. Quiet, clean and with staff that you can thrust. Minaretes close by the hotell so 5 min noise in 0630 in the morning but no problem. Owners very helpful. Recomended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value with friendly helpful owner.”
Reviews.Author: eustajoh
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for three nights. The room was spacious, comfortable, and spotless. The location is great; the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia are just a few minutes walk away. The owners do everything they can to make their guest's stay enjoyable and always have the time to answer questions. The free wi-fi works well. If you are staying three nights and book direct then they will arrange a car from the airport which is great after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Great view, Great staff, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi8888
Reviews.Content: We were there for one night after being in the Middle east for 3 weeks and it was superb. Great clean room, comfortable large bed, nice compact bathroom and an amazing view (the pictures do not do it justice). The manager was a wonderful man who took the time to show us around the hotel and was very helpful. I would definitely stay there again and believe it's better than other highly rated tripadviser hotels which we have also been to.

Reviews.Title: “great location & hospitality”
Reviews.Author: siddhkuwait
Reviews.Content: we visited turkey (istanbul & cappadocia) in sep'09. of which 6 nights were spent at ada hotel.the location of the hotel is great...attractions such as blue mosque/hagia sofiya/topkapi palace/grand bazar are in walking distance. the view of the bosphorus from the terrace is amazing. above all...dr dogan and his wife are great host's:-) we had a wonderful stay and will definitely stay at ada hotel during our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGal02
Reviews.Content: After all the great reviews we had read about Hotel Ada, we had high expectations, and we were not disappointed! From the moment we jumped out of our taxi at the hotel (with a driver demanding an outrageous off-the-meter price for a 10 minute ride), Dr. Dogan rescued us immediately by rebuking the driver in Turkish and bringing the fare down dramatically. He and his wife are delightful, soft-spoken, friendly former teachers who went out of their way to make us comfortable and happy. Our room was great, and the rooftop breakfast buffet was a real treat (eggs, cereals, toast, olives, feta cheese, dried apricots, figs, yogurt, halvah, baklava, you name it). Free phone calls to the U.S. worked just fine. The hotel's location is terrific for access to the best tourist sites and we had absolutely no complaints about our stay but for a bed that was ultra-firm. We'd love to return there some day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Huge Room, Great View, Fantastic Innkeepers”
Reviews.Author: gonein60sec
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the ADA Hotel Nov. 1 - 3 '09. We were met at the airport as planned (stay 3 nights get free airport pickup) and brought by car to the hotel where Dr.Dogan and his wife Eva took very good care of us. We had booked a sea view room for our 10 anniversay and upon arrival the good Dr. upgaded us to a larger room on the 4th floor with a fantastic view of the Marmora Sea, a Jacuzzi tub,40" flat screen, small wet bar with refridgerator, microwave, plates glass and flatware. After the long flight and being our first trip to Istanbul, walking into these accommodations set the tone for what turned out to be a fantastic trip. The breakfast Eva provided each morning on the 5 th floor terrace was very good and one had a choice of about 30 items. Yogurt, cheeses, breads, cereal, fresh fruit, olives, baklava, cold cuts etc. The hotel location is just a short 5-7 min walk to get to the major sights in Sultanamet but just far enough away to be on a quiet street (remember you are in Turkey and you will here the call to prayer!). Another big plus was free phone calls to the US and Canada from a designated phone in the lobby and a computer for the guests to use. We look forward to our next stay at the ADA Hotel, a very clean, safe hotel (really more like a B&B) run wonderful people. J&K

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Yogesh_9
Reviews.Content: We started our 2 week tour to Turkey & Greece with the stay at Hotel Ada, and I must say that we had the most comfortable stay at this place. Dr.Dogan and his wife took real good care of us. The breakfast was lavish, the rooms were clean and modern, the location was most convenient, the view from the roof top was scenic and above all, the service was most personalized. We were made to feel at home by Dr.Dogan and his team. Highly recommended and great value for money...thanks Dr.Dogan!

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Isobel99
Reviews.Content: Attached is a photo of the view from our room, which is glorious as you can see. I am staying there with my college dauther, and everything is good. The room we have is big for the standards of small hotels like this one, I mean that you can move inside the room without stumble with furniture, it has a confortable double sofa, also a jacuzzi, and the view is priceless. The hotel has been completely refurbished two years ago with taste and details. Breakfast buffet is great, with assorted fruits, cereals, salads, eggs, cheese, pastry, etc. Wifi is free in every room, which is becoming more and more important for independent travellers, there is also a laptop in the hall for those who doesn't carry one. Americans are more than happy with free calls to the States and Canada with an american direct phone. You can talk hours free of charge!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, hospitable and very good location”
Reviews.Author: PhVe
Reviews.Content: Everything brand new, which the owner is very proud of! Bathtub in the living room: a little disarming, but why not? View was excellent. And Dr. Dogan was friendly and pointed us to an excellent Kofte place.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel with very special staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NadirAhmad
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively and this was my third trip to Istanbul. There is no question in my mind that the experience my family and I had at Ada Istanbul Hotel and with the family that operates it, was the best we have ever encountered on our travels. Dogan, known affectionately as Doc, runs the hotel with his wife, and they are by far the most friendly, helpful and considerate hotel owners we have ever come across. Throughout our staff, they were ever present and always available to help with both simple and complicated questions, and always with a smile. We travelled with our 2 year old and they became very attached to them. We stayed in the deluxe suite with the ocean view and were very impressed with the size and layout of the room. This time the picture truly did not do justice to the comfort of the room. The breakfast at the roof top was an awesome experience with good food and selection, and a breathtaking view of the Sea of Marmara and the Sokullu Mehmet Pasha mosque. It was perfect and serene every morning. The location is a 5 minute walk from the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque. Overall, this is the best hotel we have stayed in, especially because of the wonderful owners. We look forward to going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jrb522
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived in Istanbul at 2am, but even at that late hour, there was a driver waiting to pick us up and the owner of the hotel was awake to greet us and show us our room. Our room was on the second floor and had spectacular views of the Sea of Marmara. The location is excellent, only blocks from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the main tram that takes you all over Istanbul. We enjoyed the wonderful breakfast every morning on the roof top deck with beautiful views. Add in free wifi and free phone calls to the US and it was definitely a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the old city, with superb sea views”
Reviews.Author: Troygoer
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel located close to the centre of the old city. The rooms and the breakfast terrace have superb sea views across the Sea of Marmara. Free internet access. Friendly English-speaking owner who can arrange excursions. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gifts when you leave? Wow!”
Reviews.Author: TooterBoston
Reviews.Content: I found this gem on TripAdvisor and was so happy with it. The location was terrific -- a short walk to the tram, 2 minutes to the Blue Mosque. Our room (303) was huge (all except for the shower which was tiny), view of the Marmara Sea, full of light and clean. Breakfast on the roof terrace was wonderful and the view from there was awesome. The hotel personnel were helpful and friendly and yes, they really gave us presents when we left and said they'd miss us. How sweet.

Reviews.Title: “More than we could have imagined”
Reviews.Author: Bamaboybutch
Reviews.Content: We spent three wonderful nights in the Ada beginning on Oct 5, 2009. I had chosen the Ada based on Trip Advisor reviews but everything was better than we had expected. The driver was waiting for us at the airport exit as Dr. Dogan had promised and our room was ready when we arrived. Dr. Dogan had taken the time to mark all the attractions I had asked about on a map with instructions on which metro stops to use, where to eat, booked our tours - everything one could ask of a hotel. Breakfast on the roof garden is a treat we'll always remember with views worth the price of the room. We had one of the jacuzzi suites and the room was huge with a wonderful view. As if these amenities weren't enough there is free internet and free calls to the US/Canada 24/7! If you are in Istanbul to visit the attractions/sights in the old city then you couldn't be better located than the ADA, you can walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern withing 5 minutes. Just a few more minutes walk and you're at the Grand Bazaar. Minutes from the metro which will get you anywhere else you want to go in Istanbul. HLB

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Views/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: renee6221
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the ADA was to celebrate our 20 year anniversary. The hotel is beautiful and has breakfast served on a rooftop terrace with an incredible view of the Sea af Marmara. We did spring for the room with the seaview which was quite large and had a microwave and fridge in it. The location is literally a block from the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sophia. We walked to every site in the old part of town and to the ferries to get to the other parts of the city. The hotel is next to a small mosque so you will hear the call to prayers early in the morning, though this should be considered part of the charm of being in Istanbul. The hotel is on a very quite street. The cab drivers did have a little trouble finding it because it is tucked away on a quite street. There is a free direct phone line to the US and Canada, wireless access throughout the hotel and a computer in the lobby with a printer. The owner goes to great lengths to help book side trips or cultural programs. He was helpful in guiding us to use public transportation rather than use expensive taxis. He booked a great cab service for us to the airport. We had to leave at 4 am to catch an early flight and the owner got up and made sure we were safely on our way. I have never had such a pleasurable stay - ever!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoon07Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The Ada Hotel is a fab hotel! Super clean rooms, comfy beds, free fast wifi, great breakfast with breathtaking views, friendly hosts. It is 1 block from the blue mosque and walking distance to all main attractions. The rooms are not massive BUT they are big enough for 2 people and VERY clean. If you are coming to Istanbul you will only use your room for sleeping and showering...the city is busy! Book online and get a free private pickup from airport (perfect after a long flight!) plus offer Dr Dogan cash and he will discount the room.

Reviews.Title: “nice located hotel with great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: user1949
Reviews.Content: It is conveniently located for all the major attractions. The breakfast on the 5th floor balcony has excellent view of the sea and food is great. It is a little bit awkward to have a jacuzzi outside the bathroom but it works fine after a day's walk in the city. Close the window for the night else it can be quite noisy. The only hotel in our 18- day Euroasia trip allows you to make free international calls.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality, comfort, view and location make the Ada Hotel spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: shelleyandjohn
Reviews.Content: Dogan and Hava were excellent hosts in every way, making our stay warm and memorable. Now, several years later, we're hoping to return and the Ada would be our first choice. Thank-you, Dogan! John and Shelley, BC, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, all rooms except suites are quite small”
Reviews.Author: ypan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at room 202, on the second floor. Even though we had booked a standard room, we were upgraded to a deluxe room. We found this room was quite small for our standards. Even though the bed was large and comfortable one side of it was adjusting to the wall. I had to close the window in order to open the closet's door. Still the rooom was very clean, which we appreciated very much. I believe the hotel breakfast could be quite better. If you plan to stay there, it's better to book one of the suites. The staff were very friendly, helpful and polite. Ada is a good small boutique hotel but definitely not #8 in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: mbearman
