Reviews.Content: Warm, firendly welcome, beautiful spacious rooms, and a fantastic roof terrace where you have breakfast. The hotel is in an excellent position near to all the historic sites 101% recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Best Place, Excellent Breakfast, Kind and Generous Hosts”
Reviews.Author: TimelessOasis
Reviews.Content: We would like to express our sincere appreciation for your kind and warm hospitality during our stay at ADA. The room was great, the breakfast was excellent, and most importantly, you were most kind and generous. Thank you very much for making our stay in Istanbul a wonderful experience. Please give our best regards to the very kind and diligent â€œbreakfast ladyâ€� as well. Best wishes for your continued success, Mohammad and Mozhgan from Iran.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IlariaG
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Ada Hotel with my two children. We had a wonderful time. The room was very spacious, extremely comfortable and we had a magnificent view over the Sea of Marmara. The Hotel is spotless clean, breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace overlooking the Sea of Marmara, a great way to start our day. Dr Dogan and his wife are extremely kind and helpful. We always looked forward to go back to our room after a busy time visiting Istanbul, and this does not happen very often away from home. The Hotel is also perfectly located, right in the middle of the main attractions, but in a very quite charming lane off the main traffic. We'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “the most friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: shivmeev
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this place. The most remarkable aspect was Dr. Dogan, the manager, who was really nice and willing to help us in everything. The hotel was super clean, the rooms were big enough for moving around, especially the rooms on the fourth level. The breakfast was good, served on the hotel's terrace with a perfect view of the sea and Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “You want to stay here during your visit to Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSteveK
Reviews.Content: In one word, "Perfect." The Ada Hotel is one of those hotels you think cannot exist anymore. It has a charming ambiance, beautiful location, sumptuous amenities, and an innkeeper and wife who are kind and sincere. Oh, did I mention location? My wife and I just completed a 23-day tour to Turkey. We began (4 days) and ended (3 days) or vacation tour at the Ada in Istanbul. As such, it was a perfect beginning and ending to our vacation. We were in very close proximity to all major sites in the Istanbul area (Sultanahmet, Serglio Point and the Bazaar Quarter) where you can easily occupy a week's time touring. We looked at other hotels in the area (by stopping in) to reassure ourselves our thinking was correct about the Ada. None compete with the Ada and its comfortable accomadations! You want to stay here during your stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Istanbul and the Ada”
Reviews.Author: nycyogini
Reviews.Content: The Ada is a lovely family-run hotel located minutes from the sights in Sultanahmet, including Haghia Sophia and Blue Mosque. Unfortunately, the taxi we picked up at the airport was unable to locate either the Ada, or the hotel of the random tourist with whom we were required to share the taxi. I would recommend contacting the kind and helpful proprietor of the Ada directly, even if you book through a third-party site like Venere as we did, to request transportation to be arranged. Our room was cozy and spotless, with a lovely view of the Sea and ruins of a Mosque, as well as a mosque designed by Sinan which you must visit as it is incredibly beautiful. We enjoyed listening to the call to prayer, but I would suggest not staying at the Ada if you are acutely sensitive to noise. While there are restaurants in the Sultanahmet area, it seems that the nightlife is centered around Taksim. We found it to be easy to travel to this area by tram. There is a stop within a ten minute walk of the Ada. Breakfast at the Ada was plentiful, though at peak times the room became a bit claustrophobic. The view of the Sea from the breakfast room and adjoining deck are amazing. We plan to visit Istanbul again, and will definitely stay at the Ada.

Reviews.Title: “The highlight of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: TravelEm01
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took a trip to Istanbul in May 2009. Staying at the Ada Hotel was one of the highlights of our trip. The hotel owner, Dr. Doogan is the nicest man! On our arrival, he upgraded us to a deluxe room for no extra charge, simply because the room was vacant. The room was spotless, with a big comfy bed, huge flat screen TV, and a jacuzzi in the bedroom. After the first couple nights, we moved into the standard room that we had actually booked and paid for, and it was still great! Spotless and cozy - just a smaller version of the same charm. Dr. Doogan was so helpful in arranging transportation to and from the airport. We had a few early morning flights, so we missed the breakfast, but he prepared a plate of bread, jams and fruit for us to take on the road. The hotel offered free internet on a laptop as well as free calls to the United States. The view from the rooftop terrace was beautiful. We enjoyed the huge breakfast spread overlooking the Bosphorus and a beautiful old mosque. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. It was truly a wonderful stay! Just a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sofia, and the tram to get to other parts of the city. Dr. Doogan was so generous and welcoming. I wonder whether he ever sleeps because he was always available for his guests - day and night. Even when we left for a flight at 4 am, he was there to see us off and wish us a great trip down to Ephesus. Thank you, Dr. Doogan! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Capetownrio
Reviews.Content: This is a great place. Wonderful staff, and couple who wn thsi old world charmign hotel. They spared no expense. It is clean and thoughtfully decorated. It has everything you need. And to top it off, it has the best breakfast I have had in Istanbul and really comfortable beds..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel, exceptionally clean, great location, friendly, helpful and non-smoking!”
Reviews.Author: sgwcp
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 days at this hotel. I was so pleased with all aspects of my stay. My room had a wonderful view from both my windows looking out over the Bosphorus and a part of the old wall. The room was a nice size, very clean, large comfortable bed and Jacuzzi tub! Included with the room was a very fresh and plentiful breakfast buffet, which you enjoy on the 5th floor terrace, overlooking the water. The room is air-conditioned with a very quiet until. Tastefully decorated. Very conveniently located too with all the popular sites and the tram within a short walk. Transfer from the airport was also included. Free wi-fi throughout hotel and access to a laptop in lobby free of charge. Also, the owners offer free, unlimited use of a phone in the lobby area where you can call anywhere in the US or Canada free! Nice touch to be able to call home easily and at no cost! The entire hotel is smoke-free, a pleasant respite from all the supposedly smoke free rooms that are just aired out as is the usual in Turkey. A pleasant his hotel is new and the owner's attended to every detail with the up most care. And speaking of the owners, they are friendly, professional and knowledgeable. Very happy to help with directions, suggestions, and pleasantly answer endless questions. I would definitely recommend and stay in again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Helpfulness”
Reviews.Author: bartschmid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ada Hotel and it was just right for us. It was extremely clean and everyone was so helpful. One of the most important things for us was that they had a "house phone" in which we were encouraged to use to call home at no cost to us or to them. We just dialed the phone as if we were in the U.S. That in itself was just fantastic. We could walk to all of the attractions and restaurants. We felt very safe and secure. We had a triple room and everything was so convenient. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abu-Aboodi
Reviews.Content: -Hotel services are great, staff are very kind and friendly, the management shows perfect hospitality, staff speacking English which is very important to tourists. -Rooms are big (bigger than the regular hotel rooms) with perfect views for the upper floor rooms. -Perfect location to the historical areas and to Marmara sea, lots of historical monuments around and can be reached by walking within minuts. -many things make this Hotel so special, above all the great terrace where we had our breakfast in as it shows a perfect panoranic view of Marmara sea.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a B&B with a great owner”
Reviews.Author: soma90
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Ada Hotel in a double room with sea view June 11-14, 2009. Let me say first that without Dr. Dogan's (owner) hosting, advice, and conversations while still would have been a very good B&B, he took it to a much higher level. When we first got to the hotel (at 7 AM from an overnight flight) via a pre-arranged Taxi service from Ataturk that Dr. Dogan had set-up, we were greeted as friends and invited for the breakfast service and our room even though we were much earlier than the check-in time. When we got to our room we truly felt this was a second Honeymoon given the view from the room. The room was very tastefully furnished and immaculate. The posted pictures of the hotel do not do it justice...it is much nicer than the pictures! The hotel is in a great neighborhood and minutes (walking) to the Sultan Ahmet mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi palace, Islamic museum, and a host of many restaurants. It is about 20 minutes walk to the Grand Bazaar, and a 15 minute metro ride to the night life/shopping of Taksim Sq. and Istiklal street. Breakfast is very good and is served in the Terrace with an even better view than our room (higher floor). Dr. Dogan can advise you on where to go for various places and he also runs a tour company that can arrange various sites in and out of Istanbul. They also provided a Taxi service on our trip out to the airport. The ADA Hotel is a MUST in you stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic & helpful”
Reviews.Author: willhein
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Ada for three nights and had a wonderful experience. The hotel has a fantastic location within very close walking distance to the major tourist sights, Blue Mosque, St. Sophia etch. When we arrived we they upgraded our room free of charge and it had a lovely view of the sea. The staff were always extremely helpful in helping us find a hammam, they bought tickets to various tours for us and were always extremely friendly. Our first morning we woke up after breakfast was finished but they insisted that they still fix us something (the rooftop where you eat is fantastic.) The only odd thing that happened was that the cost per night was in Euros and not Lira so the stay was a bit more expensive than we thought it would be. However, we noticed this in many places in Istanbul. We quickly learned to ask how whether things were priced in Euros or Lira. But again, it was a great stay in a wonderful room with wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, excellent views and wonderful hosts”
Reviews.Author: jmtravelman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ada twice, once at the beginning and again at the end of our trip to Turkey. The hosts, Dr. Dogan and his wife, truly made us feel at home. They were attentive and courteous in all ways. In a city where so many people are always trying to sell you something, you have no idea how good this can feel after a day of dealing with endless "business men" trying to sell you carpets, and waiters trying to lure you into their restaurants. The low key relaxed friendliness of Dr. Dogan and his wife is a wonderful relief at the end of a long day. The hotel has an excellent location close to most major sites in Istanbul. In addition, it borders an interesting neighborhood (in the opposite direction from all the tourist sites) where artisans work and live and you can get a glimpse of the real Istanbul while climbing the city's hills and enjoying the views. To my surprise there were several beautiful Armenian (I think) churches in the same area that don't get mentioned in the tourist brochures but that provide an interesting contrast to the world of Islam. The breakfast is on the rooftop and the food and views are superb. Our room was a little small but the space was excellently laid out with room to put all of our belongings -- something that I often miss in smaller hotels. Everything is spotless. I've noted that some reviewers complain of rooms in the basement, etc. Well, you can check the web site and request a room with a view (as I did) if this is a concern. We had exactly the room and the view that we requested. In fact, when we returned to the hotel at the end of our trip, Dr. Dogan thoughtfully gave us the same room again -- it was like coming home. The other complaint I've seen from some reviews concerns noise. It is true that there is a mosque near the hotel and the call to prayer is very early in the morning. I wasn't bothered by this, but if it's an issue for you, you should bring earplugs. And, by the way, if you're visiting other places in Turkey, you should be aware that there's almost always a mosque nearby. It is a Moslem country after all. You get used to it and for me it became part of the charm of the place. It shouldn't detract from your experience at the Ada.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - depending on what room you get”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelpros
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ADA Istanbul for a long weekend in June 2009. The hotel is perfectly located for the walking tourist and virtually all of Istanbul's sights are no more than a 5 minute walk away. The hotel is clean, staff is friendly, and the breakfast buffet is very good and the views from the roof top terrace make it actually quite amazing. One piece of advice would for all travelers to inquire directly about which room you will be staying in. I was not aware after speaking with the owners on the telephone or reviewing their website that they actually have two rooms in the basement. Yes, you can imagine your wife's heart sinking when the owner of the hotel directs her into the elevator on the first floor and tells her to go down. The basement rooms, while still very clean, are not recommended. The basement rooms have those little windows at the top of the walls facing the street that are subject to the loud noise of every passing car and walkerby. To think that we stayed at this hotel for the views - And then to be put into the basement to have a view of people's ankles as they walked by. VERY disappointing. The owner should be more clear in his descriptions of the rooms in talking and on the internet and then heavily discount these rooms in the basement. We asked to be relocated to another room but the hotel was full and the owner was unable to move us and since we were with our infant daughter we were not ambitous enough to move to another hotel. I would generally recommend this hotel, but warn all travels to confirm carefully what room they are reserving and ensure that it is not in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around”
Reviews.Author: AlexRosell
Reviews.Content: Every part of our stay at the Ada hotel was great. Most importantly the owners of the hotel Dr. Dogan and his wife Eva are the kindest of hosts. They are very attentive! I could not have asked for a better location. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Hagia Sofia and blue mosque. The Grand bazaar was about a 10 minute walk and the spice market was about a 15 minute walk. There are all sorts of shopping and restaurants very close to the hotel...yet the hotel is on a very quite street. The free breakfast was great. Our room had a great view of the Ocean. The hotel offers free internet service....and better yet...the hotel has a telephone you can use to make FREE calls to the United States and Canada. Yes...it is 100% free no catches!!! Dr. Dogan and Eva truly impressed us.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect stay, an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: D_ACanaryIslands
Reviews.Content: We have just spent seven days in Istanbul and we have stayed at the Ada Hotel Istanbul. We booked our stay in advance via email, contacting directly to Dr Dogan Sumengen , and everything was OK. They arranged the transfer from Ataturk Airport and , when arrival ,we were picked up and we got the Ada Hotel without problems.The welcome was extremely polite and Mr Dogan showed us our room: the wiew from it was outstanding, with the Sokulluk Mehmet Pasha Mosque and The Marmara Sea. Apart from this, the location of the hotel is superb, the service extremely good, everything was clean ( they cleaned the room every day) and a good breakfast-buffet is served on a terrace with a marvellous view. Considering all these characteristics it could be said that The Ada Hotel Istanbul is a good hotel, but if we add the kindness and hospitality of Mr Dogan and his wife, the Ada Hotel Istanbul becomes excellent .We highly recommend this hotel, we will come back for sure. D&A. The Canary Islands. Spain

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: anathemajones
Reviews.Content: Booked a stay at this hotel based on the glowing review from other TripAdvisor users, and was very pleased with my stay. The owner is indeed quite nice, and the room (immediately above the hotel reception), while not as high as I liked (201 I think), had a very well maintained in-room jacuzzi and the as-advertised view of the ocean. there is a PC in the reception area for those who want to access the internet, and wifi for those who want to surf from their rooms with their devices. The breakfast was great, and the owner was very willing to suggest interesting things to do. I found the included airport transfer incredibly convenient and would do it again in a heartbeat. I found the price quite reasonable; however, were I to stay in Istanbul again, I would probably stay in Begolyu rather than Sultanahmet - Sultanahmet is very nice for a first stay but I'm sure would become incredibly boring a second time around!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ccbarb1
Reviews.Content: Don (the owner) was so wonderful and accomodating to us. We went at the beginning and at the end of our triip in Turkey and it genuinely felt as though we were returning home!! He went out of his way to help us with our needs--errands, etc. He generously upgraded our room on our second stay--wonderful, large, room (compared to a smaller, tightly organized room). Breakfast was good altho they had run out of freshly brewed coffee. The location was perfect!! One needs to take advantage of Don's offer for a taxi to pick you up at the airport since it is an obscure street and the taxi he offers is cheaper than the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine; nothing terribly special”
Reviews.Author: KAE4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Ada in a deluxe room with seaview. The room was clean and the view was very lovely, but the room was awkwardly set up and a bit small. The hotel owners are perfectly nice though not quite as friendly as many of the reviews allege, and the breakfast more than met our needs. The room was very, very loud, not because of the call to prayer (which is extremely loud but so lovely it didn't bother us at all), but just because there must not be any insulation at all. Didn't get a single decent night's sleep. Not cheap nor expensive, probably a tad more than it's worth. Free wireless internet was nice! Not a bad place to stay, but I'd imagine there are better.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: redhenry
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been well reviewed and I'd just like to add my endorsement. The proprietor runs a tight ship, the place is spotless and well maintained, the breakfast room, on the top floor, has a wonderful view over the Sea of Marmara and the food is good. Highly recommended. The mosque across the road will wake you early with a call to prayer, but in a country where Islam is the principal faith, you can't really complain about that.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever hospitality we.ve ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: travelbugsLiverpool
Reviews.Content: we were in Istanbul to celebrate a special birthday. I had chosen Ada hotel after reading reviews in Tripadvisor. We couldn't have been more pleased. Our delux room had most gorgeous views overlooking the Mamaris sea with ships and boats sailing in an out. The service we received was five star plus. Owner Dr Drogan was most helpful and friendly, booking us restaurants, sightseeing trips shows etc. Nothing was too much trouble for him. We travel a lot. This was the best place we've stayed. So central all historical sights within walking distance,numerous eating places within reach and yet very quiet.We certainly would be going back again

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest hotel we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: girlosaurus
Reviews.Content: Believe all the reviews here! This is the loveliest, friendliest and most welcoming hotel my husband and I have ever stayed in. The owners, Dr Dogan and his wife (sorry, I don't know her name) live in and run the hotel and are extremely warm and helpful. They helped us with everything, suggesting restaurants, arranging food takeout (delivered to our room from various Turkish restaurants), taxis, whatever we wanted. And lots of tips on buying carpets and so on (oh, and arranged all the shipping for us and negotiated the price). We couldn't have asked for more. The hotel is in a perfect location as well, close to all the tourist sights and many shops and the Grand Bazaar. And with a view of the sea. The breakfast was lovely, and the room was very nice too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone I know - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Central & friendly”
Reviews.Author: BoyWander
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in the Ada Hotel in the historical district Sultanahmet in Istanbul. The hotel is very central, just around the corner of the Hippodrome and offers a superb view over the Sea of Marmaris. The people are very friendly and speak really excellent English. I had a double which offered a very large comfortable bed and apart from the very modern bathroom a whirlpool in the bedroom. A bit odd of course, but wait until you've done all the sights and need to be pepped up by the waterjets! The roomfare includes a great breakfast with lots of variety and fresh fruit. I certainly will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like your second home”
Reviews.Author: MajanSweden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ada Hotel Istanbul for 4 nights, spending long weekend there. I just wish to shortly share this fine experience, and to thank Dr. Dogan for his warm and welcoming way of managing the hotel. Istanbul is a fantastic city, and we had a lot to see. And every night, coming back to Ada- was like coming home! When the spring comes with some more warmth, it will be wonderful for the guests staying at Ada, to have their breakfast at the terrace- overlooking the moscue and the Bospore. I have already recommended Istanbul and Ada Hotel to my friends at work,so there will probably be 6 ladies coming for long weekend in a near future...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: jdotwdot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her for three nights and were pretty happy with the choice. The hotel is located close to the major sites in old Istanbul (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, and Topkapi Palace) but also tucked away down a quiet street a few blocks from the water. The room was small but we had a nice view of the water. Breakfast was okay but the terrace provides a great view. There is a computer for guest use in the lobby and there were also several guidebooks available to guests. The owner was very accommodating in terms of helping arrange airport transfers and making dinner reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Ada”
Reviews.Author: AbdelRahman_sarwat
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of weeks at ada hotel in December for my Honeymoon, and it was great. almost everything about the hotel was more than superb, the management, the location, the rooms, the view, ie every thing. Istanbul is really a great city, to me it is the greatest, and staying in Ada made it more enjoyable. (NB it is a small boutique hotel not a huge one) I grade each item alone as follows: The management and Staff: 10/5 (it is not a mistake, I give it double the full mark) Dr. Dogan, the owner and the manager of the hotel, is really a great person and he made our stay wonderful. He was greatlly helpful in every thing. Whenever we needed anything he was there to help, from things we needed for our stay in the hotel to guidance about the city, he even brought us a taxi when we needed one, and when e discovered that the cab driver tricked us he called the taxi company to bring us our money back. I want to say thanks a lot Dr. Dogan. Thank you from all my heart. I am sure you won't find a more friendly and helpful owner ever. The hotel actually is like the house of Dr. Dogan, and he is there to help, he and his great family 24/7 The Location: 5/5 (I also wanted to give it more than the full mark but then I will be doing this to every thing making it pointless) The location is also outstanding it is close to all you need in Istanbul. It is very close to the main attractions in Istanbul, has a sea view, and is close to the tram station. Imagine that at the end of your day you pass by hagia sofia and the blue mosque, then you end up at a room with a sea view. it is actually almost a dream came true. The only thing that some people might not like is that it is in a small street and not on the main road. the closeness to the tram is really important to point out. Due to the closeness to the tram we were able to go to almost every where, even the places that were far from sultanahmet, where ada is located, in a really comfortable and fast way The Room: 5/5 We stayed in Room 401. It is a room with a sea view (the view includes a historical Ottoman mosque and some Byzantium ruins) and Jacuzzi, and it couldn't be better. The room was really spacious with a huge and a comfortable bed, a large storage area, a great jacuzzi and a great bathroom and shower. In order to understand how nice the room was, all I need is to describe how we spent our day there, We woke up at a sea view drank up a cup of tea, then we went to the breakfast terrace, then we went out, enjoyed Istanbul to it's full extent, then came back and spent some relaxing time in the jacuzzi then went to bed a slept like babies before enjoying the next day and so on. to put it short, room 401 was perfect, nothing less The breakfast: 3.5/5 (the only thing that doesn't get the full mark) The breakfast was great, but lacked variance. It is not a fancy hotel breakfast, it is just like home breakfast. I don't say the food was bad, on the contrary it was delicious and all what you need was there, but don\t dream of a large table with different kinds of food from all areas. and also a disadvantage is that all the days were the same. To put it short, you will like the food, but not as much as you will like everything about ada. But to make it clear, the breakfast terrace is breath-taking like that of the room and even more Others: 5/5 Everything else was great, the high speed internet, which is free, fast and working 24 hours. I used to download a disney movie every day, I started it before I left in the morning and when I came back at night it was completed. There was complementary tea bags and everything else was great. Conclussion: Istanbul to me is the greatest place to be and in Istanbul, Ada hotel is one of the best places to be, if not the best Again, thank you Dr. Dogan and Thank you Ada

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: pontikak
Reviews.Content: Lovely, clean room overlooking the column. Staff (owner and wife) very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel to Remember”
Reviews.Author: Sue_and_Bear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ada Hotel for 8 nights this past December. We can highly recommend the Ada for the following reasons: 1) It is small (<20 rooms), tastefully decorated, clean and cared for with pride by the owner. 2) The owner, Dr. Dogan Sumengen, works everyday and is a wonderful and helpful man. He alone will make your stay a pleasant one as he is always willing to provide helpful advise and arrange excursions and reservations. 3) The Ada is ideally located. The neighbourhood is quiet but you are less than a 10 minute walk to all major attractions. i.e the Blue Mosque is 2 blocks away 4) Our room was a suite and worth the extra cost. The windows in our room provided a spectacular view of the Marmara Sea. A jacuzzi tub was strategically located to allow you to enjoy the view after a long day of sightseeing. 5) The breakfasts had a healthy selection of choices and were served on the top floor , again with a wonderful view. In summary we enjoyed our stay at the Ada and hope to return to sample more of Dr. Dogan's hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: gennadi_s
Reviews.Content: Very friendly owner and staff, home atmosphere. Very clean, new modern room equipment. Thanks for our nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Quiet Hotel, very close to the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: bellah15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel because we were looking for something quiet that was close to the sights that we wanted to see. The hotel was everything that we were looking for. We had booked a standard room, which did not include a view. This was fine with us, since we were only there to sleep. And you can get a good view when you have breakfast. Because it was November, we did not need to open the windows or have the air conditioning on. Since our room only have a view of another building there wasn't any road noise. We actually stayed here twice, at the beginning of our trip and at the end of out trip. Since we were flying in and out of Istanbul to the US. We were upgraded to a view room on our second stay. The view was nice. Only slightly more noisy because of the occasional car but nothing I couldn't sleep thought. This hotel was clean, very close to all the sights in SaltanAmed and the owner of the hotel was very nice. He accomodated the requests that I had given when booking this room. This hotel was the most expensive hotel that we stayed during our trip in Turkey, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Ada Istanbul in Dec 08”
Reviews.Author: SachinSharjah
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 11 persons (3 families with kids) just returning from a great trip of Istanbul, Turkey. We stayed at Ada Istanbul and found the hotel to be perfect for a family stay. Great views from the rooms and the rooftop where a sumptuous breakfast is served. Very friendly host in Dogan who goes out of the way to make us comfortable as well as explain the sights of Istanbul, Location is just about perfect in a quiet area of the old city but yet within walking distance of the main attractions like Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Grand Bazaar + the tram station is just nearby. One can take the tram to get to modern city areas of Taksim or the cruise stations within 10-15 minutes. We loved the place and would highly recommend to anyone visiting Istanbul. Sachin

Reviews.Title: “not what it seems”
Reviews.Author: caroleWarwickshireUK
Reviews.Content: Nov 29th 2008 Carole from England Firstly i ask who these people are that are giving the Ada a 5 rating. We stay in Istanbul each year, this was the worst hotel. I must say it was very clean but not what we or other guests expected. We booked the standard room which was standard and filled with oversized beds and no room to move. It was the location we found most concerning. It is located in a drab run down back street on a very very steep hill. If you took a typical victorian terrace being very narrow with six floors,the entrance / lounge is at best 10ft wide with a ikea desk and replica chairs with old lace tops. The breakfast room has slatted wooden fold up chairs and benches in again a 10ft wide room, Yes the views were great. Food was quite good for Istanbul breakfasts but the same every day and little fresh fruit. The set up was odd and maxed out with bedrooms and not space to move.there was no lounge or and spare space to relax. Will not stay at the Ada again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view,Nice and Friendly Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Randjie
Reviews.Content: Subject: Ada Hotel Istanbul Location: Istanbul, Turkey Title: Nice,friendly, excellent family hotel ID#: 21621836 we stayed at the Ada hotel from October 29 till November 2 and had a great time with my mother and sister. We had a triple room with Jacuzzi. There isn't much that I can add to the reviews. It is all true, the view, the location, the great service, the clean rooms. Mr. Sumengen and his family were very helpful and friendly. I read a few reviews of people who were not satisfied, and moved to a hotel uptown or to one of the major hotels. I think this is because of the star rate. You should not compare the hotels in the old city to the famous hotels. There is a difference in the star rating. In the old city are all the major tourist attractions, you won't find any hotels from the famous hotel chains. I approve of that, that's how the old city remains it's authentic character. If that's not what you are looking for, I would advice you to move to the European site, there you will find the famous hotels, the atmosphere and the appearance equal to any big city in the world. If you want to enjoy the great history of Istanbul, meet locals and save on excursions, book a room at Ada hotel. Ada hotel is in walking distance of all the major attractions (max. 5 minutes)...Blue Mosque..Grand Bazaar etc etc

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable hotel but not great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Alias34632
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ada hotel for three nights, and the hotel was ok but not more. We had quite high expectations after having read all the nice reviews, and though it was a quite nice hotel the value for money was not excellent. For the price we paid we would have expected something a bit more exclusive. The positive things: - Friendly and helpful staff. - The airport pickup worked out really fine. - The view from the room over the sea was nice. - The jacuzzi in front of the window (only in some rooms). - The view from the roof when eating breakfast. - Fridge and microwave in the room. - Free wireless internet (though a bit unstable at times) What we liked a bit less: - The breakfast could have been a little more varied and a bit more nourishing (this might be a cultural difference, I like to eat quite a lot in the morning :-) - The location is really good for visiting the Blue mosque and Hagia Sofia. However there are not a lot of restaurants in the area. If we go back we would probably stay in the Taksim-TÃ¼nnel area with more restaurants, and then we would go by tramway during the day to Sultanhamet to visit the touristic sites. - The bathroom was a bit plastic. - Value for money was so and so...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hosts. Clean rooms. Great location. Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Calator_Fericit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ada Hotel in September 2008 for 4 nights. It is fabulous. The room was clean and comfortable, the breakfast was excellent and served on the beautiful terrace with great views. Not all rooms have jacuzzis, however this did not bother us at all. Mr. Dogan is an extremely helpful host. When we had issues booking a bus out of Istanbul he made all the necessary phone calls and helped us. Every time we had a question, he would find out the answer for us, which was much appreciated. The Location of the hotel is amazing. Barely 5 minutes away from the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Ada is a great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Social_Cook
Reviews.Content: The Ada was a great hotel for our stay in September 2008. Our family of 2 adults and one eleven-year-old really enjoyed the breakfasts and the views from the breakfast terrace. The hosts were very helpful. The pick-up from the airport worked a treat. The location of the hotel makes it extremely accessible for all the Istanbul sights. The only downsides were that our room was quite small and we had no view from our room. Iâ€™d be happy to look past that though for another stay at the Ada on our hoped-for next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Ada Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: crunchkin
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Ada -- from the hospitable hosts to the delicious and plentiful breakfasts to the clean and spacious rooms to the wonderful location. The Ada is on a relatively quiet side street (very close to two other hotels, the Stone and the Daphne) but within a five to ten minute walk of almost every major tourist attraction! We stayed at the Ada for five nights in September 2008 and then for a final night after our "blue cruise" in the Aegean. At first glance, the lobby of the hotel seems a bit more like a guesthouse -- very simple and homey -- but the rooms were exceptionally lovely and spacious and (from what we saw of other hotels) unusually comfortable at that price range for Istanbul. Our first room was 401 -- a good-sized jacuzzi room with a large bed and a gorgeous view of the Sea of Marmara and nearby mosque. There's a wide window ledge on which I would stretch out enjoying the view (it was almost like having a terrace), and the room was nicely but simply furnished with a sofa to stretch out on, too, and attractive hardwood floors. Each day the cleanliness of the room was unsurpassed -- it was the cleanest hotel room I've ever been in, with everything sparkling. The jacuzzi was welcome after a day of sightseeing (sometimes just to soak my tired feet!) and the bed was extremely comfortable, with soft and pristine linens. The room also had a mini-refrigerator stocked with bottled water, soft drinks, and beer, and quiet and very effective air-conditioning. ( We learned that Dr. Sumengen can also provide wine, although it's not kept in the rooms.) After we returned from our Blue Cruise, Dr. Sumengen upgraded us to a jacuzzi suite (Room 203) for our one remaining night. This room was even more lovely, and was extra spacious -- almost palatial, with a microwave, mini-refrigerator, cutlery and dishes, furnished with lovely rugs and a very comfortable sofa and chairs as well as a large and comfy bed. Throughout both stays, we looked forward to our breakfasts on the fifth floor sea-view terrace-- with fresh peaches, grapes, melon and (on some days) fresh figs, an assortments of breads, two kinds of cheese, and cereals, yogurt, tomatoes, olives, halvah, honey, butter, tea, brewed coffee, etc. We would sit and watch the boats and the birds soaring overhead (a similar view to the one in both of our rooms.) The warmth and hospitality of Dr. and Mrs. Sumengen were also unsurpassed, and the young woman who assisted at breakfast and cleaning was kind and attentive to our needs. (During our earlier stay there was also a helpful young man who assisted us in printing out our boarding passes for our flight to Bodrum.) We used the free internet, used our ATT calling card to make calls to the States from the room at no extra charge, and will definitely stay at the Ada if we come to Istanbul again! Indeed, when we returned to the Ada after our cruise, it truly felt as if we were returning to stay with friends -- kudos to the hotel and its owner and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: gwenmart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ada Hotel for eight days in September 2008-- four at the beginning of our trip and four at the end. We were all very pleased. The location is great and the price is extremely reasonable for the area. The beds and shower are very good. Staff is warm and hospitable and very gracious. English is somewhat limited but this did not pose any problem at all. Breakfast is served on the terrace. The view is fantastic--mosque, Sea of Marmaris, ships in the harbor. We never tired of it. Breakfast includes fruit, fresh and dried; breads and cakes; cereal; meats; cheese; and delicious halvah.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically helpful”
Reviews.Author: CaramutJane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ada Hotel with my husband and three children under five. We stayed in the downstairs family room which had direct access to the street, and was easy to get our pram in and out of. The accommodation was inexpensive and the staff at the hotel, particularly Dr Sumengen, extremely helpful, friendly and hospitable. Breakfast was great - fresh and varied, with fantastic views over the sea. Any questions or problems were immediately addressed. We were also picked up at the airport, which is a wonderful service, especially for people with children. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge beds”
Reviews.Author: anka4u
Reviews.Content: We (a couple) stayed ih this hotel with a friend in a standart triple room. Needless to say that not all the rooms are equiped with jacuzzi or have a view. We didn't have any view at all, except on a tiny interior yard with all of the nearby air conditional systems in it. So the room didn't have a lot of light and one could hear the noise of the air conditional systems during the whole night in spite of the closed windows. However, it didn't prevent us from falling asleep. The room appeared quite small for three of us because of the size of the beds: there were huge. The double bed was enough for four people and the single was like a double. Those left very litte space for movement. Moreover, the bathroom had a transparent door, located just in front of the single bed. Everything could be seen in detail, which was not very charming, especially for my partner, who shared the room with a friend of mine. There was a small kitchenette beside the room with tea coffee making facilities. However, when we entered the room, everything was cristall clean except the kitchen floor, literaly covered with long black hair. The other unconvenient thing was the fact that the front door was always closed and Mr Dogan had to open it everytime we were coming back late. However, the bed are great, the breakfast has a lot of choice, the view is stunning, the location is great for visiting Sultanahmet, the owners were nice and helpful. I would recomend this hotel but not the room.

Reviews.Title: “Ada a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: flembers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and wished we'd stayed for more. We booked a jacuzzi room with a sea view. What a great view from the bedroom, a mosque and surroundings and the sea. The hotel was great, very comfortable, we slept well as the bed was very comfortable. We were picked up from the airport and loved the area that the hotel was in. It felt like we were somewhere that real local people lived. The hotel staff were very friendly and breakfast was really delicious with cereals, juices, coffee, yoghurt and lots of delicious fruit. Breakfast was on the roof terrace with a view of the mosque and sea. We were well looked after. The hotel is in a great location and near Hagia Sofia, The Blue Mosque and the palace and many of the attractions. The jacuzzi was a welcome addition especially after a long day sightseeing. A great hotel. I recommend it highly and loved Istanbul. Our stay was a most enjoyable one and we hope to visit again. Linda and Maddie

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, personalized service”
Reviews.Author: mahleen
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nites and was picked up fr. airport by the hotel transportation. the hotel owner is very accomodating and goes beyond expectations. he's like your personal concierge. they are very warm and very nice people. it's walking distance to blue mosque, hagia sophia, grand bazaar, etc. the hotel is in a very quiet place and the breakfast terrace has amazing view of marmara sea. the room is very clean with jacuzzi and individual AC. this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: RodicaOttawa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel - we would not hesitate to return there and will recommend it to others. Very nice equipped rooms. Good breakfast. Located in the old center of Istanbul. Owners and stuff very friendly and helpful. Thank you so very much! Rodica & Dan, Ottawa

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: mkj123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ada Hotel for 6 nights and loved it. As we walked around Istanbul, we saw many of the hotels that we perused on the internet and were glad not to be in them as they were located on very busy streets. The Ada Hotel is located on a small winding cobblestone street that most drivers avoid, but just a couple minute walk from Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The view from our room was stunning as was the view from the terrace where we ate breakfast. We loved the owner and his wife who were always helpful and genuinely warm. We booked the hotel because we heard that the rooms were a little bigger than most boutique hotels in Istanbul. We are two friends traveling together and found the room completely comfortable for the two of us. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Can't wait to get back!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelMan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Athens/Lesvos Island/Istanbul trip with family. Our time at the Ada was one of the best. The short version is that Dr. Sumengen delivered on everything - the rooms were spotless, very well equipped, very nice fresh fruit/vegetable/cheeses style breakfast with fantastic view, perfect location all at a very reasonable price. As other reviewers have said, Dr. Sumengen was so helpful in many things from reservations to helping with transfers to local recommendations. Highly recommended and can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Vancouvertraveller99
Reviews.Content: I booked the Ada Hotel after reading the great reviews on Trip Advisor - and the former guests were right - it's a great find in Istanbul. We booked a large room with views over the Marmara - beautiful views! The hosts were helpful, friendly and very welcoming. Breakfasts on the deck were a wonderful way to start the day! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, friendly, reliable hotel in old town Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: carterjon
Reviews.Content: A lovely small hotel in quiet residential neighborhood just around the corner from all the major sights of the old town (Blue Mosque, Bazaar, etc.). Views of the Sea of Marmara from some of the rooms. Just renovated in the last couple of years, so modern, clean and very functional, though fairly spartan in decor. The proprietor is a retired professor who seems to work 24 hours a day, always there to open the front door personally, helpful with advice, directions, further travel arrangements. The only surprise was being woken abruptly the first night at 4am by the call to prayer from the mosque situated right next (and scenically) to the hotel, so if you don't want this, sleep with your window closed. For us, just added to the atmosphere. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best of of rooms, location, service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: love2tr4vel
Reviews.Content: From the moment we landed to the moment we left we had the best experience at Ada Hotel. We were on our honeymoon which included Istanbul, Athens (Intercontinental 5* Luxury Hotel), Mykonos (Pelican Art Hotel) and Santorini. Our stay at this hotel was the best in terms of the entire experience. Their breakfast spread is lovely, their hospitality put us in a constant good mood, the rooms were immaculately clean and the bathrooms were pristine. We had a jacuzzi in our room and the view from the window was beautiful (we often sat on the large window sill looking out). It is a 2 minute walk to the blue mosque. The manager accommodated all our requests and everyday we looked forward to retiring to the comfort of our hotel after a long day of touristy activities. I really have no negatives about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great host”
Reviews.Author: JackR46
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a suite for 3 nights at the beginning of a private tour of Turkey and for 2 nights at the end of the tour. Plus: location close to the hippodrome/blue mosque, spacious room, fantastic host, wonderful view from the hotel roof-top breakfast area, clean and comfortable. Negative: minimal soundproofing, so rooms facing the street are a bit noisy at certain times during the day and evening (no problems if you use ear plugs at night, like I do!) Not for the Sheraton/Hyatt crowd but great for those who like a smaller, "boutique" type hotel with some local flavor. (with an elevator, air-conditioning and free computer access)

Reviews.Title: “Old School Hospitatily!”
Reviews.Author: FK97
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Turkey and I have to say that this hotel is the only reason I still thing Turkish people are not out to get you! Dr. Sumengen is one of the most caring and trustworthy people I have ever met in my life. I really felt that I could trust him with anything. Plus on top of everything the hotel is spotless. I have a real issue with Turkish bathrooms but our room at the Ada was soooooooo clean. The room was very cozy and modern. AC worked great. TV worked great. everything smelled great! Free internet. Free airport transfers. The breakfast is good and more than plenty on a beautiful terrace. Just wake up earlier than the others to get outside seating on the terrace. The location is absolutely wonderful. We walked everywhere to all the sites. within 5 mins we were in the middle of the tourist action (blue mosque, topkapi, etc). And the owners are so absolutely warm and really really care about you as a human being. I cannot thank him and his wife enough. I was really screwed over by my tour company and when I went to go say hello to Dr. Sumengen when I got back to Istanbul from my blue cruise...his wife and he really tried to comfort us even though we were not even guests at their hotel! Honestly, stay here if you can...it might be hard to get a room on short notice because the hotel is popular and so well priced but book NOW!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: familyholidayz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ada Hotel for one night as the Stone Hotel, located next door, had overbooked. We stayed in one of the rooms in the basement and it was huge. The room had a massive tv, tea making facility, cutlery, crockery, fridge and even a microwave! The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. In the morning we had breakfast at the hotel and I have to say the view from the breakfast room was amazing. The terrace gave a unique view of the ruined mosque opposite the hotel and the sea. The owner was very pleasant and helpful. He told us about the supermarket (as we needed milk for our toddler) located nearby and told us of places to eat. I have to say we were a little disappointed with ourselves that we hadn't discovered The Ada before.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: POPA-JOE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ada Hotel in the Sultanahmet area one night prior to a cruise out of Istanbul. Prior Tripadvisor reviews were right on; the Ada gets high marks for location (2 blocks from the Blue Mosque), views overlooking the Sea Marmara, cleaniliness, comfortable bedding, quiet, a good breakfast. Dr. and Mrs. Sumangen, the owners, were very hospitable; they couldn't do enough for us. Picked 4 of us up at the airport using a large van. Helped us find a place for a good meal. Gave us tips on getting around. Provided transportation to the ship. Will definitely stay at the Ada again if we return to Istanbul. Istanbul is a great city; easy to get around in. The Grand Bazaar is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alpinehiker
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this lovely hotel and enjoyed it tremendously. Mr. Dogan was very accommodating and gave us great recommendations and advice about traveling in the city. The rooms are immaculate and comfortable. It is so unbelievably quiet we never heard any of the other guests coming or going. Breakfast is served upstairs, either inside or out on the terrace, with a view of Istanbul, and offers an assortment of fresh fruit, breads and cereals. It felt very home-like and we were treated graciously. Best of all, the location is fantastic and we were offered complimentary pick-up from the airport. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great solution in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: marcel22
Reviews.Content: A very good place just in the historical city center. I have just returned from and I can say it's a great destination. Magnificent views from the room and from the roof terrace, very friendly staff and an irreproachable cleanness. I have been in Istanbul for the third time and Ada did the best. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Ada!”
Reviews.Author: Marrissa83
Reviews.Content: We were in Turkey for our honeymoon in November 2007 and had chosen to stay at ADA hotel after reading good reviews here in TA. It was everything we imagined. Small yet comfy and very homey. And home it was for us for the next 5 days. We had initially booked a double room but Dogan graciously upgraded us to a suite at no extra charge when we checked in! We were terribly grateful to Dogan of course for the suite, especially that we are on our honeymoon. The suite comes with a huge bed and a jacuzzi right next to it! The room was spacious. At first we thought, it was too big for the 2 of us but by the end of the week, we had shopping bags literally covering every inch of floor space! The toilet had all the basic necessities and it was extremely clean. Our suite is located on the 1st floor but we didnâ€™t get disturbed by other guests walking in and out of the lobby. Nor were we awoken by the morning prayer calls from the mosque directly opposite our window. Even if we did, it wonâ€™t bother us much. It's a Muslim country.. it's all part of the experience! Breakfast was ok. Not wide spread but enough to keep us full till noon. And the lady who prepared the food was very polite, not forgetting to greet us every single morning. The breakfast area is at the rooftop with a wonderful view of the Marmara sea. Hubby & I will always be the first to be at breakfast and spend some quiet time admiring the view. We had a great stay and would highly recommend ADA hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: sientemiamor
Reviews.Content: I must say that we had a lovely experience at the Ada Hotel. Most important, the owner (Dr. Dogan Sumengen) and his wife were incredibly kind and accommodating to us. We were visiting for just over a week from the United States (also met lots of other guests from the U.S. at the hotel, too!). The rooms are lovely -- as large as we needed for 2 people, and they have a great view of the ocean. Very nice and clean, all of the fixtures and furniture are new. They also provide a coffee maker which they refill with water every day (they advise not to use the tap water) as well as tea bags and instant coffee. The hotel is about 2 blocks away from all of the big sites in Sultanahment (Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia) and about 4 blocks from the Sultanahmet tram station. You should have no trouble getting there -- we always had taxis drop us near the Haghia Sophia and we'd walk back ourselves. It's very convenient. Unfortunately, I got food poisoning on our last day, but Dogan was kind enough to translate all of my symptoms into Turkish so we could better communicate with the pharmacist. By the way, there's a pharmacy just around the corner, which came in extremely handy! We also had an inconvenient flight time for our departure -- we left the hotel at 3:00 a.m., but he arranged for a car service for us, and even had a small breakfast waiting when we came down to the lobby. Can't say enough great things about this place. I would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat and highly suggest you do, too!

Reviews.Title: “a little jewel in the old town”
Reviews.Author: blownaway11
Reviews.Content: we just spent 5 days in Istanbul, in the ADA Hotel: what a great place!! The owner and his wife are fluent in English, very friendly and helpful: we were picked up at the airport and they arranged for trips and taxis. We had an enormous room with a splendid view of the Sea of Marmara, a jacuzzi, a little kitchen area and a very modern bathroom; also the hotel is eco-friendly in that electricity use is controlled with automatic lights and room keys. Breakfast is breathtaking: it is served on the top floor on a terrace with a ripping view of the Sea and is very generous. The hotel is right in Old Town Istanbul, steps away from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace, very convenient, and what an ambiance!

HotelInfo.Name: Ada Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Sehit Mehmetpasa Yokusu Sokak No:30 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
